spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: mem_ctrl
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Memory controller

spirit:register.spirit:name: mcfg1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Memory configuration register 1

spirit:field.spirit:name: io_bus_width
spirit:field.spirit:description: I/O bus width. Defines the data width of the I/O area. 2'b00 : 8 2'b01 : 16 2'b10 : 32 2'b11 : Reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: io_ws
spirit:field.spirit:description: I/O wait states. Defines the number of wait states during I/O accesses. 4'b0000 : 0 4'b0001 : 1 . 4'b1111: 15

spirit:field.spirit:name: io_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: I/O enable. If set, access to the memory bus I/O area is enabled.

spirit:field.spirit:name: prom_wr_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: PROM write enable. If set, enables write cycles to the PROM area.

spirit:field.spirit:name: prom_width
spirit:field.spirit:description: PROM width. Defines the data width of the PROM area. 2'b00 : 8 2'b01 : 16 2'b10 : 32 2'b11 : Reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: prom_wr_ws
spirit:field.spirit:description: PROM write wait states. Defines the number of wait states during PROM write cycles. 4'b0000 : 0 4'b0001 : 1 . 4'b1111: 15

spirit:field.spirit:name: prom_rd_ws
spirit:field.spirit:description: PROM read wait states. Defines the number of wait states during PROM read cycles. 4'b0000 : 0 4'b0001 : 1 . 4'b1111: 15

spirit:register.spirit:name: mcfg2
spirit:register.spirit:description: Memory configuration register 2

spirit:field.spirit:name: sdram_refresh
spirit:field.spirit:description: SDRAM refresh. If set, the SDRAM refresh will be enabled.

spirit:field.spirit:name: sdram_trp
spirit:field.spirit:description: SDRAM tRP timing. tRP will be equal to 2 or 3 system clocks (0/1).

spirit:field.spirit:name: sdram_trfc
spirit:field.spirit:description: SDRAM tRFC timing. tRFC will be equal to 3 + field-value system clocks.

spirit:field.spirit:name: sdram_cas_dly
spirit:field.spirit:description: SDRAM CAS delay. Selects 2 or 3 cycle CAS delay (0/1). When changed, a LOAD-COMMAND-REGISTER command must be issued at the same time. Also sets RAS/CAS delay (tRCD).

spirit:field.spirit:name: sdram_bank_size
spirit:field.spirit:description: SDRAM banks size. Defines the banks size for SDRAM chip selects. 3'b000 : 4 Mbyte 3'b001 : 8 Mbyte . 3'b111 : 512 Mbyte

spirit:field.spirit:name: sdram_cmd
spirit:field.spirit:description: SDRAM command. Writing non-zero value will generate an SDRAM command. The field is reset after command has been executed. 2'b00 : Reserved 2'b01 : PRECHARGE 2'b10 : AUTO-REFRESH 2'b11 : LOAD-COMMAND-REGISTER

spirit:field.spirit:name: sdram_64
spirit:field.spirit:description: 64-bit SDRAM. If set, the SDRAM controller is configured to use 64-bit wide SDRAM.

spirit:field.spirit:name: sdram_enable
spirit:field.spirit:description: SDRAM enable. If set, the SDRAM controller will be enabled.

spirit:field.spirit:name: sram_disable
spirit:field.spirit:description: SRAM disable. If set together with bit 14 (SDRAM enable), the static RAM access will be disabled.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ram_bank_size
spirit:field.spirit:description: RAM bank size. Defines the size of each RAM bank. 4'b0000 : 8 Kbyte 4'b0001 : 16 Kbyte . 4'b1111 : 256 Mbyte

spirit:field.spirit:name: bus_rdy_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Bus ready enable. If set, will enable BRDYN for RAM area.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rmw
spirit:field.spirit:description: Read-Modify-Write. Enable read-modify-write cycles on sub-word writes to 16- and 32-bit areas with common write strobe (no byte write strobe).

spirit:field.spirit:name: ram_width
spirit:field.spirit:description: RAM width. Defines the data width of the RAM area. 2'b00 : 8 2'b01 : 16 2'b10 : 32 2'b11 : Reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: ram_wr_ws
spirit:field.spirit:description: RAM write wait states. Defines the number of wait statesduring RAM write cycles. 2'b00 : 0 2'b01 : 1 2'b10 : 2 2'b11 : 3

spirit:field.spirit:name: ram_rd_ws
spirit:field.spirit:description: RAM read wait states. Defines the number of wait states during RAM read cycles. 2'b00 : 0 2'b01 : 1 2'b10 : 2 2'b11 : 3

spirit:register.spirit:name: mcfg3
spirit:register.spirit:description: Memory configuration register 3

spirit:field.spirit:name: sdram_refresh_val
spirit:field.spirit:description: Reload value for the SDRAM refresh counter.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: ahb_stat
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: AHB Status

spirit:register.spirit:name: ahb_failing
spirit:register.spirit:description: AHB failing address

spirit:field.spirit:name: ahb_failing
spirit:field.spirit:description: AHB failing register. The address of the transaction that caused an AHB error response.

spirit:register.spirit:name: ahb_status
spirit:register.spirit:description: AHB status register

spirit:field.spirit:name: error
spirit:field.spirit:description: Error. This bit is set when an error occurred. Write a 1 to clear this field.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rw
spirit:field.spirit:description: RW - Read/Write. This bit is set if the failed access was a read cycle, otherwise it is cleared.

spirit:field.spirit:name: hmaster
spirit:field.spirit:description: HMASTER - AHB master. This field contains the HMASTER[3:0] of the failed access.

spirit:field.spirit:name: hsize
spirit:field.spirit:description: HSIZE - transfer size. This field contains the HSIZE[2:0] of the failed transfer.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: cache_controller
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Cache Controller

spirit:register.spirit:name: cache_control
spirit:register.spirit:description: Cache control register (CRR)

spirit:field.spirit:name: drepl
spirit:field.spirit:description: Data cache replacement policy (DREPL): 2'b00 : no replacement policy (direct-mapped cache) 2'b01 : random 2'b10 : least-recently-replaced (LRR) 2'b11 : least-recenty-used (LRU)

spirit:field.spirit:name: irepl
spirit:field.spirit:description: Instruction cache replacement policy (IREPL): 2'b00 : no replacement policy (direct-mapped cache) 2'b01 : random 2'b10 : least-recently-replaced (LRR) 2'b11 : least-recenty-used (LRU)

spirit:field.spirit:name: isets
spirit:field.spirit:description: Instruction cache associativity (ISETS) - Number of sets in the instruction cache: 2'b00 : direct mapped 2'b01 : 2-way associative 2'b10 : 3-way associative 2'b11 : 4-way associative

spirit:field.spirit:name: dsets
spirit:field.spirit:description: Data cache associativity (DSETS) - Number of sets in the data cache: 2'b00 : direct mapped 2'b01 : 2-way associative 2'b10 : 3-way associative 2'b11 : 4-way associative

spirit:field.spirit:name: ds
spirit:field.spirit:description: Data cache snoop enable (DS) - If set, will enable data cache snooping.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fd
spirit:field.spirit:description: Flush Data cache (FD) - If set, will flush the data cache. Always reads as zero.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fi
spirit:field.spirit:description: Flush Instruction cache (FI) - If set, will flush the instruction cache. Always reads as zero.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ib
spirit:field.spirit:description: Instruction burst fetch (IB) - This bit enables burst fill during instruction fetch.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ip
spirit:field.spirit:description: Instruction cache flush pending (IP) - This bit is set when an instruction cache flush operation is in progress.

spirit:field.spirit:name: dp
spirit:field.spirit:description: Data cache flush pending (DP) - This bit is set when a data cache flush operation is in progress.

spirit:field.spirit:name: dcf
spirit:field.spirit:description: Data Cache Freeze on Interrupt (DCF) - If set, the data cache will automatically be frozen when an asynchronous interrupt is taken.

spirit:field.spirit:name: icf
spirit:field.spirit:description: Instruction Cache Freeze on Interrupt (ICF) - If set, the instruction cache will automatically be frozen when an asynchronous interrupt is taken.

spirit:field.spirit:name: dcs
spirit:field.spirit:description: Data Cache State (DCS) - Indicates the current data cache state according to the following: 2'b00 : Disabled 2'b01 : Frozen 2'b10 : Disabled 2'b11 : Enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: ics
spirit:field.spirit:description: Instruction Cache State (ICS) - Indicates the current instruction cache state according to the following: 2'b00 : Disabled 2'b01 : Frozen 2'b10 : Disabled 2'b11 : Enabled

spirit:register.spirit:name: power_down
spirit:register.spirit:description: Power down register

spirit:field.spirit:name: pd
spirit:field.spirit:description: The processor can be powered-down by writing an arbitrary value to the power-down register. Power-down mode will be entered on the next load or store instruction. To enter power-down mode immediately, a store to the power-down register should be performed followed by a dummy load.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: write_prot
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Write Protection

spirit:register.spirit:name: write_prot1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Write protection register 1

spirit:field.spirit:name: en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enable (EN) - If set, enables the write protect unit

spirit:field.spirit:name: bp
spirit:field.spirit:description: Block Protect (BP) - If set, selects block protect mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: tag
spirit:field.spirit:description: Address tag (TAG) - This field is compared against address (29:15)

spirit:field.spirit:name: mask
spirit:field.spirit:description: Address mask (MASK) - This field contains the address mask

spirit:register.spirit:name: write_prot2
spirit:register.spirit:description: Write protection register 2

spirit:field.spirit:name: en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enable (EN) - If set, enables the write protect unit

spirit:field.spirit:name: bp
spirit:field.spirit:description: Block Protect (BP) - If set, selects block protect mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: tag
spirit:field.spirit:description: Address tag (TAG) - This field is compared against address (29:15)

spirit:field.spirit:name: mask
spirit:field.spirit:description: Address mask (MASK) - This field contains the address mask

spirit:register.spirit:name: leon_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: LEON configuration register

spirit:field.spirit:name: dsu
spirit:field.spirit:description: Debug support unit present 1'b0 : disabled 1'b1 : present

spirit:field.spirit:name: nwindows
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of register windows. The implemented number of SPARC register windows - 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: icsz
spirit:field.spirit:description: Instruction cache size. The size (in Kbytes) of the instruction cache. Cache size = 2^icsz.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ilsz
spirit:field.spirit:description: Instruction cache line size. The line size (in 32-bit words) of each line. Line size = 2^ilsz.

spirit:field.spirit:name: dcsz
spirit:field.spirit:description: Data cache size. The size (in Kbytes) of the data cache. Cache size = 2^dcsz.

spirit:field.spirit:name: dlsz
spirit:field.spirit:description: Data cache line size. The line size (in 32-bit words) of each line. Line size = 2^dlsz.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ahb_stat
spirit:field.spirit:description: Memory status and failing address register present

spirit:field.spirit:name: pci_core
spirit:field.spirit:description: PCI core type 2'b00 : none 2'b01 : InSilicon 2'b10 : ESA 2'b11 : Other

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: timers
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Timers

spirit:register.spirit:name: timer1_counter
spirit:register.spirit:description: Timer 1 counter register

spirit:register.spirit:name: timer1_reload
spirit:register.spirit:description: Timer 1 reload register

spirit:register.spirit:name: timer1_control
spirit:register.spirit:description: Timer 1 control register

spirit:field.spirit:name: ld
spirit:field.spirit:description: Load counter (LD) - When written with 1, will load the timer reload register into the timer counter register. Always reads as a 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rl
spirit:field.spirit:description: Reload counter (RL) - If RL is set, then the counter will automatically be reloaded with the reload value after each underflow.

spirit:field.spirit:name: en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enable (EN) - Enables the timer when set.

spirit:register.spirit:name: watchdog_counter
spirit:register.spirit:description: Watchdog counter register

spirit:register.spirit:name: timer2_counter
spirit:register.spirit:description: Timer 2 counter register

spirit:register.spirit:name: timer2_reload
spirit:register.spirit:description: Timer 2 reload register

spirit:register.spirit:name: timer2_control
spirit:register.spirit:description: Timer 2 control register

spirit:field.spirit:name: ld
spirit:field.spirit:description: Load counter (LD) - When written with 1, will load the timer reload register into the timer counter register. Always reads as a 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rl
spirit:field.spirit:description: Reload counter (RL) - If RL is set, then the counter will automatically be reloaded with the reload value after each underflow.

spirit:field.spirit:name: en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enable (EN) - Enables the timer when set.

spirit:register.spirit:name: prescaler_counter
spirit:register.spirit:description: Prescaler counter register

spirit:register.spirit:name: prescaler_reload
spirit:register.spirit:description: Prescaler reload register

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: uarts
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: UARTS

spirit:register.spirit:name: uart1_data
spirit:register.spirit:description: UART1 data register

spirit:field.spirit:name: data
spirit:field.spirit:description: Holding register for both read and write access

spirit:register.spirit:name: uart1_status
spirit:register.spirit:description: UART1 status register

spirit:field.spirit:name: fe
spirit:field.spirit:description: Framing error (FE) - Indicates that a framing error was detected.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pe
spirit:field.spirit:description: Parity error (PE) - Indicates that a parity error was detected.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ov
spirit:field.spirit:description: Overrun (OV) - Indicates that one or more characters have been lost due to overrun.

spirit:field.spirit:name: br
spirit:field.spirit:description: Break received (BR) - Indicates that a BREAK has been received.

spirit:field.spirit:name: th
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmitter hold register empty (TH) - Indicates that the transmitter hold register is empty.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ts
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmitter shift register empty (TS) - Indicates that the transmitter shift register is empty.

spirit:field.spirit:name: dr
spirit:field.spirit:description: Data ready (DR) - Indicates that new data is available in the receiver holding register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: uart1_control
spirit:register.spirit:description: UART1 control register

spirit:field.spirit:name: ec
spirit:field.spirit:description: External clock (EC) - If set, the UART scaler will be clocked by PIO[3].

spirit:field.spirit:name: lb
spirit:field.spirit:description: Loop back (LB) - If set, loop back mode will be enabled.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fl
spirit:field.spirit:description: Flow control (FL) - If set, enables flow control using CTS/RTS.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pe
spirit:field.spirit:description: Parity enable (PE) - If set, enables parity generation and checking.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ps
spirit:field.spirit:description: Parity select (PS) - Selects parity polarity. 1'b0 : even parity 1'b1 : odd parity

spirit:field.spirit:name: ti
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmitter interrupt enable (RI) - If set, enables generation of transmitter interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ri
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receiver interrupt enable (RI) - If set, enables generation of receiver interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: te
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmitter enable (TE) - If set, enables the transmitter.

spirit:field.spirit:name: re
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receiver enable (RE) - If set, enables the receiver.

spirit:register.spirit:name: uart1_scaler
spirit:register.spirit:description: UART1 scaler register

spirit:register.spirit:name: uart2_data
spirit:register.spirit:description: UART2 data register

spirit:field.spirit:name: data
spirit:field.spirit:description: Holding register for both read and write access

spirit:register.spirit:name: uart2_status
spirit:register.spirit:description: UART2 status register

spirit:field.spirit:name: fe
spirit:field.spirit:description: Framing error (FE) - Indicates that a framing error was detected.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pe
spirit:field.spirit:description: Parity error (PE) - Indicates that a parity error was detected.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ov
spirit:field.spirit:description: Overrun (OV) - Indicates that one or more characters have been lost due to overrun.

spirit:field.spirit:name: br
spirit:field.spirit:description: Break received (BR) - Indicates that a BREAK has been received.

spirit:field.spirit:name: th
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmitter hold register empty (TH) - Indicates that the transmitter hold register is empty.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ts
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmitter shift register empty (TS) - Indicates that the transmitter shift register is empty.

spirit:field.spirit:name: dr
spirit:field.spirit:description: Data ready (DR) - Indicates that new data is available in the receiver holding register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: uart2_control
spirit:register.spirit:description: UART2 control register

spirit:field.spirit:name: ec
spirit:field.spirit:description: External clock (EC) - If set, the UART scaler will be clocked by PIO[3].

spirit:field.spirit:name: lb
spirit:field.spirit:description: Loop back (LB) - If set, loop back mode will be enabled.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fl
spirit:field.spirit:description: Flow control (FL) - If set, enables flow control using CTS/RTS.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pe
spirit:field.spirit:description: Parity enable (PE) - If set, enables parity generation and checking.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ps
spirit:field.spirit:description: Parity select (PS) - Selects parity polarity. 1'b0 : even parity 1'b1 : odd parity

spirit:field.spirit:name: ti
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmitter interrupt enable (RI) - If set, enables generation of transmitter interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ri
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receiver interrupt enable (RI) - If set, enables generation of receiver interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: te
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmitter enable (TE) - If set, enables the transmitter.

spirit:field.spirit:name: re
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receiver enable (RE) - If set, enables the receiver.

spirit:register.spirit:name: uart2_scaler
spirit:register.spirit:description: UART2 scaler register

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: irqctrl
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Interrupt controller

spirit:register.spirit:name: int_mask
spirit:register.spirit:description: Interrupt mask register

spirit:field.spirit:name: ilevel
spirit:field.spirit:description: Interrupt level (ILEVEL[15:1]) - Indicates whether an interrupt belongs to priority level 1 (ILEVEL[n]=1 or level 0 (ILEVEL[n]=0).

spirit:field.spirit:name: imask
spirit:field.spirit:description: Interrupt mask (IMASK[15:1]) - Indicates whether an interrupt is masked (IMASK[n]=0 or enabled (IMASK[n]=1).

spirit:register.spirit:name: int_pending
spirit:register.spirit:description: Interrupt pending register

spirit:field.spirit:name: ipend
spirit:field.spirit:description: Interrupt pending (IPEND[15:1]) - Indicates whether an interrupt is pending (IPEND[n]=1).

spirit:register.spirit:name: int_force
spirit:register.spirit:description: Interrupt force register

spirit:field.spirit:name: iforce
spirit:field.spirit:description: Interrupt force (IFORCE[15:1]) - Indicates whether an interrupt is being forced (IFORCE[n]=1).

spirit:register.spirit:name: int_clear
spirit:register.spirit:description: Interrupt clear register

spirit:field.spirit:name: iclear
spirit:field.spirit:description: Interrupt clear (ICLEAR[15:1]) - If written with a 1, will clear the corresponding bit(s) in the interrupt pending register. A read returns 0.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: io_port
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: I/O Port

spirit:register.spirit:name: io_val
spirit:register.spirit:description: I/O port input/output register

spirit:field.spirit:name: ioval
spirit:field.spirit:description: IOVALn - I/O port value. On a read the I/O ports that are configured as inputs return their current value. When written, the value will be driven onto the I/O ports that are configured as outputs.

spirit:register.spirit:name: io_dir
spirit:register.spirit:description: I/O port direction register

spirit:field.spirit:name: iodir
spirit:field.spirit:description: IODIRn - I/O port direction. The value of IODIR[15:0] defines the direction of I/O ports 15 - 0 (PIO[15:0]). If bit n is set the corresponding I/O port becomes an output, otherwise it is an input. IODIR[16] controls D[15:8] while IODIR[17] controls D[7:0].

spirit:register.spirit:name: io_int_cfg
spirit:register.spirit:description: I/O port interrupt config register

spirit:field.spirit:name: en3
spirit:field.spirit:description: EN3 - Enable. If set, the corresponding interrupt will be enabled, otherwise it will be masked.

spirit:field.spirit:name: le3
spirit:field.spirit:description: LE3 - Level/edge triggered. If set, the interrupt will be edge-triggered, otherwise level sensitive.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pl3
spirit:field.spirit:description: PL3 - Polarity. If set, the corresponding interrupt will be active high (or edge-triggered on positive edge). Otherwise, it will be active low (or edge-triggered on negative edge).

spirit:field.spirit:name: isel3
spirit:field.spirit:description: ISEL3 - I/O port select. The value of this field defines which I/O port (0 - 31) should generate parallel I/O port interrupt 3.

spirit:field.spirit:name: en2
spirit:field.spirit:description: EN2 - Enable. If set, the corresponding interrupt will be enabled, otherwise it will be masked.

spirit:field.spirit:name: le2
spirit:field.spirit:description: LE2 - Level/edge triggered. If set, the interrupt will be edge-triggered, otherwise level sensitive.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pl2
spirit:field.spirit:description: PL2 - Polarity. If set, the corresponding interrupt will be active high (or edge-triggered on positive edge). Otherwise, it will be active low (or edge-triggered on negative edge).

spirit:field.spirit:name: isel2
spirit:field.spirit:description: ISEL2 - I/O port select. The value of this field defines which I/O port (0 - 31) should generate parallel I/O port interrupt 2.

spirit:field.spirit:name: en1
spirit:field.spirit:description: EN1 - Enable. If set, the corresponding interrupt will be enabled, otherwise it will be masked.

spirit:field.spirit:name: le1
spirit:field.spirit:description: LE1 - Level/edge triggered. If set, the interrupt will be edge-triggered, otherwise level sensitive.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pl1
spirit:field.spirit:description: PL1 - Polarity. If set, the corresponding interrupt will be active high (or edge-triggered on positive edge). Otherwise, it will be active low (or edge-triggered on negative edge).

spirit:field.spirit:name: isel1
spirit:field.spirit:description: ISEL1 - I/O port select. The value of this field defines which I/O port (0 - 31) should generate parallel I/O port interrupt 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: en0
spirit:field.spirit:description: EN0 - Enable. If set, the corresponding interrupt will be enabled, otherwise it will be masked.

spirit:field.spirit:name: le0
spirit:field.spirit:description: LE0 - Level/edge triggered. If set, the interrupt will be edge-triggered, otherwise level sensitive.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pl0
spirit:field.spirit:description: PL0 - Polarity. If set, the corresponding interrupt will be active high (or edge-triggered on positive edge). Otherwise, it will be active low (or edge-triggered on negative edge).

spirit:field.spirit:name: isel0
spirit:field.spirit:description: ISEL0 - I/O port select. The value of this field defines which I/O port (0 - 31) should generate parallel I/O port interrupt 0.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: irqctrl2
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Secondary interrupt controller

spirit:register.spirit:name: int_mask
spirit:register.spirit:description: Secondary interrupt mask register

spirit:field.spirit:name: imask
spirit:field.spirit:description: Interrupt mask - Indicates whether an interrupt is masked (IMASK[n]=0 or enabled (IMASK[n]=1).

spirit:register.spirit:name: int_pending
spirit:register.spirit:description: Secondary interrupt pending register

spirit:field.spirit:name: ipend
spirit:field.spirit:description: Interrupt pending - Indicates whether an interrupt is pending (IPEND[n]=1).

spirit:register.spirit:name: int_status_clear
spirit:register.spirit:description: Secondary interrupt status and clear register

spirit:field.spirit:name: iclear
spirit:field.spirit:description: Interrupt clear - If written with a 1, will clear the corresponding bit(s) in the interrupt pending register. A read returns 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ip_or_iclear
spirit:field.spirit:description: Interrupt pending - If set, then IRL is valid. If cleared, no unmasked interrupt is pending. When written, clears pending secondary interrupt 5.

spirit:field.spirit:name: irl_or_iclear
spirit:field.spirit:description: Interrupt request level - Indicates the highest unmasked pending interrupt. When written, clears the pending secondary interrupts (4:0) that have their bit set to 1.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: dsu_uart
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: DSU UART

spirit:register.spirit:name: dsu_status
spirit:register.spirit:description: DSU status register

spirit:field.spirit:name: fe
spirit:field.spirit:description: Framing error (FE) - Indicates that a framing error was detected.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ov
spirit:field.spirit:description: Overrun (OV) - Indicates that one or more characters have been lost due to overrun.

spirit:field.spirit:name: th
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmitter hold register empty (TH) - Indicates that the transmitter hold register is empty.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ts
spirit:field.spirit:description: Transmitter shift register empty (TS) - Indicates that the transmitter shift register is empty.

spirit:field.spirit:name: dr
spirit:field.spirit:description: Data ready (DR) - Indicates that new data has been received and not yet read-out by the AHB master interface.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dsu_control
spirit:register.spirit:description: DSU control register

spirit:field.spirit:name: bl
spirit:field.spirit:description: Baud rate locked (BL) - Is automatically set when the baud rate is locked.

spirit:field.spirit:name: en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Receiver enable (RE) - If set, enables both the transmitter and receiver.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dsu_scaler
spirit:register.spirit:description: DSU scaler register

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: Version

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_fifo
spirit:register.spirit:description: TX FIFO control and status

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_af
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO almost full status field. A 1 indicates an almost full or full FIFO. This bit is set when there are between fifo_aft and fifo_depth number of entries in the FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_ae
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO almost empty status field. A 1 indicates an almost empty or empty FIFO. This bit is set when there are between 0 and fifo_aet number of entries in the FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_full
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO full status field. A 1 indicates a full FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_empty
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO empty status field. A 1 indicates an empty FIFO.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_fifo
spirit:register.spirit:description: RX FIFO control and status

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_af
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO almost full status field. A 1 indicates an almost full or full FIFO. This bit is set when there are between fifo_aft and fifo_depth number of entries in the FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_ae
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO almost empty status field. A 1 indicates an almost empty or empty FIFO. This bit is set when there are between 0 and fifo_aet number of entries in the FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_full
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO full status field. A 1 indicates a full FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_empty
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO empty status field. A 1 indicates an empty FIFO.

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_data
spirit:register.spirit:description: TX data

spirit:field.spirit:name: val
spirit:field.spirit:description: Byte to write into the TX FIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_data
spirit:register.spirit:description: RX data

spirit:field.spirit:name: val
spirit:field.spirit:description: Byte to read from the RX FIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: control
spirit:register.spirit:description: Control

spirit:field.spirit:name: prescaler
spirit:field.spirit:description: Prescaler reload value round(module clock frequency / baud rate)

spirit:register.spirit:name: timeout
spirit:register.spirit:description: Timeout

spirit:field.spirit:name: val
spirit:field.spirit:description: > 0: If no character was received within this number of module clock cycles and RX FIFO is not empty RX IRQ will be asserted. If a new character is received before timer expiry or when the timer is expired, the timer is reset and restarted. 0: Disables the timeout functionality

spirit:register.spirit:name: errors
spirit:register.spirit:description: Errors - Write 1 to clear

spirit:field.spirit:name: overrun_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Overrun Error: If this is 1 the RX FIFO was full and a received character had to be discarded

spirit:field.spirit:name: stop_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Stop Error: If this is 1 a character was received but a 0 was seen in the middle of what was expected to be the stop bit; this condition does not impact how the received character is treated

spirit:field.spirit:name: start_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Start Error: A falling edge on the UART RX line was detected but before reaching the middle of the start bit a 1 was seen; this condition does not impact how the received character is treated

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: Version

spirit:register.spirit:name: prescaler
spirit:register.spirit:description: I2C prescaler

spirit:field.spirit:name: prescaler
spirit:field.spirit:description: Prescaler reload value. The value defines the number of clocks in a quarter SCL period. E.g. for a 60MHz clock and a prescaler value of 15 a 1000 KHz SCL will be generated (60e6 * (1 / (15 * 4))).

spirit:register.spirit:name: fifo
spirit:register.spirit:description: I2C FIFO control and status

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_af
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO almost full status field. A 1 indicates an almost full or full FIFO. This bit is set when there are between fifo_af_lvl and fifo_depth number of entries in the FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_ae
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO almost empty status field. A 1 indicates an almost empty or empty FIFO. This bit is set when there are between 0 and fifo_ae_lvl number of entries in the FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_full
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO full status field. A 1 indicates a full FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_empty
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO empty status field. A 1 indicates an empty FIFO.

spirit:register.spirit:name: control
spirit:register.spirit:description: I2C control

spirit:field.spirit:name: error
spirit:field.spirit:description: Error status field. A 1 indicates that a transaction error occurred. This could be due to a NAK or a read from the bus when the FIFO is full. This bit is sticky until the clear field is asserted or a new transaction is started.

spirit:field.spirit:name: clock_stretch_active
spirit:field.spirit:description: This status field indicates whether the I2C master is currently being clock stretched (this requires clock_stretch_en to be 1)

spirit:field.spirit:name: force_sda_low
spirit:field.spirit:description: Write a 1 to force the SDA line to 0. Clear this field for normal behaviour.

spirit:field.spirit:name: read_byte_count
spirit:field.spirit:description: Write the number of bytes that should be read from the I2C device before ending the transaction. The value should not be bigger than the FIFO depth.

spirit:field.spirit:name: clear
spirit:field.spirit:description: Write a 1 to clear the I2C master. This clears the FIFO and resets the state machine. The clear bit must be asserted for at least 2 PCLK cycles. HW does NOT clear this field so SW should write a 0 to this field after it has written a 1 to clear the I2C master.

spirit:field.spirit:name: opmode
spirit:field.spirit:description: Mode of Operation: 2'b00 : I2C Read 2'b01 : I2C Write / SMBus Byte Write / SMBus Block Write 2'b10 : SMBus Byte Read 2'b11 : SMBus Block Read

spirit:field.spirit:name: go
spirit:field.spirit:description: Write a 1 to initiate an I2C transaction. HW will clear this field upon completion and also generates an interrupt. A new transaction should not be attempted until this field returns a 0, indicating it is not busy.

spirit:register.spirit:name: wr_data
spirit:register.spirit:description: I2C write data

spirit:field.spirit:name: wr_data
spirit:field.spirit:description: Byte to write into the I2C master FIFO.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd_data
spirit:register.spirit:description: I2C read data

spirit:field.spirit:name: rd_data
spirit:field.spirit:description: Byte to read from the I2C master FIFO.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: irq
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: I2C Master Interrupt register group

spirit:register.spirit:name: enable
spirit:register.spirit:description: Interrupt Enable register - Write 1 to enable, 0 to mask an interrupt

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_ae
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO almost empty NOTE: If the FIFO is empty when this interrupt is enabled, it will cause an interrupt right away!

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending
spirit:register.spirit:description: Pending register - This indicates which events are pending, Write 1 to clear

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_ae
spirit:field.spirit:description: Level-triggered - Active High FIFO almost empty NOTE: If the FIFO is empty, this event is pending and if enabled will cause an interrupt!

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending_irq
spirit:register.spirit:description: Interrupt Pending register - This indicates which pending events are enabled to cause an interrupt

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_ae
spirit:field.spirit:description: Level-triggered - Active High FIFO almost empty

spirit:register.spirit:name: raw
spirit:register.spirit:description: This register contains the registered state of interrupt signals

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_ae
spirit:field.spirit:description: Current state of the FIFO almost empty flag (Active-High)

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_af
spirit:field.spirit:description: Current state of the FIFO almost full flag (Active-High)

spirit:field.spirit:name: done
spirit:field.spirit:description: Current state of the transfer done flag (Active-High)

spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO almost full status field. A 1 indicates an almost full or full FIFO. This bit is set when there are between fifo_aft and fifo_depth number of entries in the FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_ae
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO almost empty status field. A 1 indicates an almost empty or empty FIFO. This bit is set when there are between 0 and fifo_aet number of entries in the FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_full
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO full status field. A 1 indicates a full FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_empty
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO empty status field. A 1 indicates an empty FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_af
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO almost full status field. A 1 indicates an almost full or full FIFO. This bit is set when there are between fifo_aft and fifo_depth number of entries in the FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_ae
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO almost empty status field. A 1 indicates an almost empty or empty FIFO. This bit is set when there are between 0 and fifo_aet number of entries in the FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO full status field. A 1 indicates a full FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_empty
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO empty status field. A 1 indicates an empty FIFO.

spirit:register.spirit:name: slave_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Config

spirit:field.spirit:name: no_status
spirit:field.spirit:description: Do not send the status byte

spirit:field.spirit:name: stop_clks
spirit:field.spirit:description: Declare a start (P) if there were at least stop_clks + 2 clock cycles between the SCL rising edge and the SDA rising edge

spirit:field.spirit:name: start_clks
spirit:field.spirit:description: Declare a start (S) if there were at least start_clks + 2 clock cycles between the SDA falling edge and the SCL falling edge

spirit:field.spirit:name: sda_glitch
spirit:field.spirit:description: Filter glitches up to this number + 1 clock cycles on the SDA line

spirit:field.spirit:name: scl_glitch
spirit:field.spirit:description: Filter glitches up to this number + 1 clock cycles on the SCL line

spirit:register.spirit:name: timeout
spirit:register.spirit:description: Timeout

spirit:field.spirit:name: val
spirit:field.spirit:description: Timeout value in number of clock cycles (SMBus) A value of 0x0 disables the timeout (I2C)

spirit:register.spirit:name: status
spirit:register.spirit:description: Status

spirit:field.spirit:name: device_busy
spirit:field.spirit:description: Device Busy - set by the hardware at the end of a transaction by the Master that writes to the request data area. Cleared by the slave CPU when it has read the data and responded to the command.

spirit:field.spirit:name: req_nak
spirit:field.spirit:description: Request NAK - set by the slave if a request could not be filled; the reply data will need to be read before the hardware will clear this bit (same as Reply Data Ready)

spirit:field.spirit:name: reply_data_rdy
spirit:field.spirit:description: Reply Data Ready - set by SW when data is ready for the master; cleared by HW when the output FIFO is empty

spirit:field.spirit:name: reply_req
spirit:field.spirit:description: Reply Request - indicates the type of data the slave has for the master. If set, the data is a reply to a previous request from the master. If cleared, this is unsolicited status information the slave has for the master

spirit:register.spirit:name: wr_data
spirit:register.spirit:description: Write data

spirit:field.spirit:name: wr_data
spirit:field.spirit:description: Byte to write into the output FIFO.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd_data
spirit:register.spirit:description: Read data

spirit:field.spirit:name: rd_data
spirit:field.spirit:description: Byte to read from the input FIFO.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: irq
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Interrupt register group

spirit:register.spirit:name: enable
spirit:register.spirit:description: Interrupt Enable register - Write 1 to enable, 0 to mask an interrupt

spirit:field.spirit:name: out_fifo_ae
spirit:field.spirit:description: Output FIFO almost empty NOTE: If the FIFO is empty when this interrupt is enabled, it will cause an interrupt right away!

spirit:field.spirit:name: in_fifo_ae
spirit:field.spirit:description: Input FIFO almost empty NOTE: If the FIFO is empty when this interrupt is enabled, it will cause an interrupt right away!

spirit:field.spirit:name: write_nack
spirit:field.spirit:description: Write data was NACK-ed by the slave

spirit:field.spirit:name: read_nack
spirit:field.spirit:description: Read data was NACK-ed by the master

spirit:field.spirit:name: no_read_data
spirit:field.spirit:description: Read data is requested but there is no data to provide (slave is clock stretching if enabled or else returning all 1s)

spirit:field.spirit:name: timeout
spirit:field.spirit:description: SCL was low for timeout.val module clock cycles

spirit:field.spirit:name: write
spirit:field.spirit:description: The bit after an acknowledged slave address indicates a write operation

spirit:field.spirit:name: read
spirit:field.spirit:description: The bit after an acknowledged slave address indicates a read operation

spirit:field.spirit:name: start
spirit:field.spirit:description: Start or Repeated Start bit detected

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending

spirit:field.spirit:description: Level-triggered - Active-High Input FIFO almost full

spirit:field.spirit:name: in_fifo_ae
spirit:field.spirit:description: Level-triggered - Active High Input FIFO almost empty NOTE: If the FIFO is empty, this event is pending and if enabled will cause an interrupt!

spirit:register.spirit:description: Interrupt Pending register - This indicates which pending events are enabled to cause an interrupt

spirit:field.spirit:description: Level-triggered - Active-High Output FIFO almost full

spirit:field.spirit:description: Level-triggered - Active High Output FIFO almost empty

spirit:field.spirit:name: in_fifo_ae
spirit:field.spirit:description: Level-triggered - Active High Input FIFO almost empty

spirit:field.spirit:description:
Operation Code: ST <00>: 2'b00 : Address 2'b01 : Write 2'b10 : Post-Read-Increment-Address 2'b11 : Read
ST <01>: 2'b00 : Reserved 2'b01 : Write 2'b10 : Read 2'b11 : Reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: st
spirit:field.spirit:description: Start of Frame pattern: 2'b00 : Clause 45 of IEEE 802.3 (Indirect Address) 2'b01 : Clause 22 of IEEE 802.3 (Direct Address)

spirit:field.spirit:name: go
spirit:field.spirit:description: Write a 1 to initiate an MDIO transaction. HW will clear this field upon completion and also generates an interrupt. A new transaction should not be attempted until this field returns a 0, indicating it is not busy.

spirit:field.spirit:description: Tri-State value for each IO when not active

spirit:field.spirit:name: sck_oe_deassert_cfg
spirit:field.spirit:description: SCK OE deassert configuration 0 : one cycle before last action finish 1 : aligned with last action finish 2-15 : n-1 (1-14) cycles after last action finish

spirit:field.spirit:name: cs_deassert_cfg
spirit:field.spirit:description: CS deassert configuration 0 : one cycle before last action finish 1 : aligned with last action finish 2-15 : n-1 (1-14) cycles after last action finish

spirit:field.spirit:name: sck_oe_assert_cfg
spirit:field.spirit:description: SCK OE assert configuration 0 : one cycle after first action start 1 : aligned with first action start 2-15 : n-1 (1-14) cycles before first action start

spirit:field.spirit:name: cs_assert_cfg
spirit:field.spirit:description: CS assert configuration 0 : one cycle after first action start 1 : aligned with first action start 2-15 : n-1 (1-14) cycles before first action start

spirit:register.spirit:description: Address Offset

spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of dummy clock cycles - 0 means no dummy clock cycles

spirit:field.spirit:description: Minimum number of SPI clock cycles + 3 that CS should be deasserted after a read command

spirit:field.spirit:name: io_mask_data
spirit:field.spirit:description: IO mask for the read data

spirit:field.spirit:name: io_mask_cmd
spirit:field.spirit:description: IO mask for the read command

spirit:register.spirit:name: xip_cfg
spirit:register.spirit:description: eXecute In Place Configuration

spirit:field.spirit:name: xip_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: XIP Enable - The first read transaction following the assertion of this bit will have the basic_cfg.read_cmd and xip_cfg.mode_xip bits - Following read transactions will not have a read command and will use xip_cfg.mode_xip bits - The read transaction following the de-assertion of this bit will not have a read command and use xip_cfg.mode_normal bits - Following read transactions will use basic_cfg.read_cmd and xip_cfg.mode_normal bits (Default)

spirit:field.spirit:name: io_mask_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description: IO Mask for the mode bits

spirit:field.spirit:name: num_mode_bits
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of mode bits to send - 0 means no mode bits are sent - 8 is the maximum

spirit:field.spirit:name: mode_xip
spirit:field.spirit:description: Mode bits when there is no command (XIP mode)

spirit:field.spirit:name: mode_normal
spirit:field.spirit:description: Mode bits when there is an command (normal read mode)

spirit:register.spirit:name: suspend_cfg
spirit:register.spirit:description: Suspend Configuration

spirit:field.spirit:name: tr_gap_p3
spirit:field.spirit:description: Minimum number of SPI clock cycles + 3 that CS should be deasserted after suspend command

spirit:field.spirit:name: enable
spirit:field.spirit:description: This should be set by SW when a suspend command should be executed before an incoming read request can be handled. This would be the case if a program or erase is in progress. This bit gets cleared as soon as the suspend command is executed.

spirit:field.spirit:name: io_mask
spirit:field.spirit:description: IO Mask for the suspend command

spirit:field.spirit:name: module_sel
spirit:field.spirit:description: Module select - To read a version of a particular module, set this field to the index of the module in the feature register - If a module has more than one version, use the version_sel field to select the one of interest - Once the right module is selected and where applicable the right version within the module, issue a read of the module_version register to obtain the version of interest - Note that a module must be present to be able to read its version - Note that some modules do not have a register interface and as a result do not have a version

spirit:register.spirit:name: freq_det
spirit:register.spirit:description: Frequency Detect register

spirit:field.spirit:name: count
spirit:field.spirit:description: Count value used for frequency calculation: if (ref_clk_faster) freq_min(det_clk) = freq(ref_clk)*((count+2)/(max_count+1)) freq_max(det_clk) = freq(ref_clk)*((count+4)/(max_count-1)) else freq_min(det_clk) = freq(ref_clk)*((max_count+2)/(count+1)) freq_max(det_clk) = freq(ref_clk)*((max_count+4)/(count-1))

spirit:field.spirit:name: ref_clk_faster
spirit:field.spirit:description: This field determines if the reference clock (CPU Clock) is faster than the measured clock (Active-High)

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_count
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the value used for the i_counter_max port of the freq_det module.

spirit:field.spirit:name: clk_sel
spirit:field.spirit:description: This field determines which clock is going to be measured: 0 : XMII RX Clock 1 : GE CLM RX Clock 2-7 : Reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: go
spirit:field.spirit:description: Write a 1 to initiate frequency detection. HW will clear this field upon completion. Once cleared the frequency calculation can be done.

spirit:register.spirit:name: freq_det_dp
spirit:register.spirit:description: Frequency Detect DP register

spirit:field.spirit:name: count
spirit:field.spirit:description: Count value used for frequency calculation: if (ref_clk_faster) freq_min(det_clk) = freq(ref_clk)*((count+2)/(max_count+1)) freq_max(det_clk) = freq(ref_clk)*((count+4)/(max_count-1)) else freq_min(det_clk) = freq(ref_clk)*((max_count+2)/(count+1)) freq_max(det_clk) = freq(ref_clk)*((max_count+4)/(count-1))

spirit:field.spirit:name: ref_clk_faster
spirit:field.spirit:description: This field determines if the reference clock (CPU Clock) is faster than the measured clock (Active-High)

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_count
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the value used for the i_counter_max port of the freq_det module.

spirit:field.spirit:name: clk_sel
spirit:field.spirit:description: This field determines which clock is going to be measured: 0 : DP GTREFCLK1 (TX Reference Clock) 1 : DP GTREFCLK0 (RX Recovered Clock) 2-7 : Reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: go
spirit:field.spirit:description: Write a 1 to initiate frequency detection. HW will clear this field upon completion. Once cleared the frequency calculation can be done.

spirit:register.spirit:name: freq_det_dp_auto
spirit:register.spirit:description: Frequency Detect DP Auto register

spirit:field.spirit:name: auto_enable
spirit:field.spirit:description: Automatic Mode Enable: 0 : Manual Mode 1 : Automatic Mode

spirit:field.spirit:name: comp_ref_clk_faster
spirit:field.spirit:description: In automatic mode the freq_det_dp.ref_clk_faster gets compared with this value

spirit:field.spirit:name: comp_count_max
spirit:field.spirit:description: In automatic mode the freq_det_dp.count gets compared with this value

spirit:field.spirit:name: comp_count_min
spirit:field.spirit:description: In automatic mode the freq_det_dp.count gets compared with this value

spirit:field.spirit:description: When this is set to 1, it forces the FPGA PIPE TX to Electrical Idle. Only used for hardware test to isolate the PIPE RX path from cross talk of TX path.

spirit:field.spirit:name: strapping_done
spirit:field.spirit:description: This register is used for dynamic strapping to select the proper path for strap options: xtal_dis and ssc_dis. Assert high when strapping is completed (This should be asserted after PHY is out of reset using rst_b). See also "out_enable"

spirit:field.spirit:name: xtal_dis
spirit:field.spirit:description: Strap Option - Selects an input clock source 0 : Crystal input 1 : Clock input

spirit:field.spirit:name: ssc_dis
spirit:field.spirit:description: Strap Option - Spread spectrum clocking disable 0 : SSC enable 1 : SSC disable

spirit:field.spirit:name: power_present_sel
spirit:field.spirit:description: Power Present Select for the ULP: 0 : VBUS Detect 1 : usb3phy_ctrl.power_present register field

spirit:field.spirit:name: out_enable
spirit:field.spirit:description: Assert high to enable PHY outputs. Assert after PHY is out of reset and when dynamic strapping is complete. See rst_b and strapping_done.

spirit:register.spirit:name: ge_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: GE Control

spirit:field.spirit:name: boot_sel
spirit:field.spirit:description: Boot Select 0 : Program Mode 1 : Boot from Flash

spirit:register.spirit:name: xmii_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: XMII Control

spirit:register.spirit:name: rs232_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: RS232 Control

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: drp
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: DRP register group

spirit:register.spirit:name: drp_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: DRP Control and Write Data. Note: make sure this register is setup before writing to the drp_en_mask register

spirit:register.spirit:name: drp_en_mask
spirit:register.spirit:description: DRP Enable Mask for each DRP bus. - A write to this register initiates a transaction to each enabled DRP bus. - A field gets cleared when its respective DRP bus asserts DRPRDY. Note: before attempting a new transaction, make sure no DRP bus is busy (all fields should be cleared) Note: always enable exactly 1 DRP bus for read transfers, write transfers can have any combination of DRP buses enabled Note: following a read transaction make sure the DRP bus has asserted DRPRDY (its DRP Enable Mask field should be cleared) before reading the drp_read_data register.

spirit:field.spirit:name: sl_5g_gt0
spirit:field.spirit:description: DRP Enable Mask for SL 5G GT0

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxaui_gt1
spirit:field.spirit:description: DRP Enable Mask for RXAUI GT1

spirit:field.spirit:name: rxaui_gt0
spirit:field.spirit:description: DRP Enable Mask for RXAUI GT0

spirit:field.spirit:name: link_mmcm

spirit:field.spirit:name: link_gt_common
spirit:field.spirit:description: DRP Enable Mask for Link GT COMMON

spirit:field.spirit:name: dp_gt_txoutclk_mmcm
spirit:field.spirit:description: DRP Enable Mask for DP GT TXOUTCLK MMCM

spirit:register.spirit:description: DRP Read Data Note: make sure the DRP bus has asserted DRPRDY (its DRP Enable Mask field in the drp_en_mask register should be cleared) before reading this register

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: Version

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_fifo
spirit:register.spirit:description: TX FIFO control and status

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_af
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO almost full status field. A 1 indicates an almost full or full FIFO. This bit is set when there are between fifo_aft and fifo_depth number of entries in the FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_ae
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO almost empty status field. A 1 indicates an almost empty or empty FIFO. This bit is set when there are between 0 and fifo_aet number of entries in the FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_full
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO full status field. A 1 indicates a full FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_empty
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO empty status field. A 1 indicates an empty FIFO.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_fifo
spirit:register.spirit:description: RX FIFO control and status

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_af
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO almost full status field. A 1 indicates an almost full or full FIFO. This bit is set when there are between fifo_aft and fifo_depth number of entries in the FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_ae
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO almost empty status field. A 1 indicates an almost empty or empty FIFO. This bit is set when there are between 0 and fifo_aet number of entries in the FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_full
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO full status field. A 1 indicates a full FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: fifo_empty
spirit:field.spirit:description: FIFO empty status field. A 1 indicates an empty FIFO.

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_data
spirit:register.spirit:description: TX data

spirit:field.spirit:name: val
spirit:field.spirit:description: Byte to write into the TX FIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_data
spirit:register.spirit:description: RX data

spirit:field.spirit:name: val
spirit:field.spirit:description: Byte to read from the RX FIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: control
spirit:register.spirit:description: Control

spirit:field.spirit:name: prescaler
spirit:field.spirit:description: Prescaler reload value round(module clock frequency / baud rate)

spirit:register.spirit:name: timeout
spirit:register.spirit:description: Timeout

spirit:field.spirit:name: val
spirit:field.spirit:description: > 0: If no character was received within this number of module clock cycles and RX FIFO is not empty RX IRQ will be asserted. If a new character is received before timer expiry or when the timer is expired, the timer is reset and restarted. 0: Disables the timeout functionality

spirit:register.spirit:name: errors
spirit:register.spirit:description: Errors - Write 1 to clear

spirit:field.spirit:name: overrun_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Overrun Error: If this is 1 the RX FIFO was full and a received character had to be discarded

spirit:field.spirit:name: stop_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Stop Error: If this is 1 a character was received but a 0 was seen in the middle of what was expected to be the stop bit; this condition does not impact how the received character is treated

spirit:field.spirit:name: start_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Start Error: A falling edge on the UART RX line was detected but before reaching the middle of the start bit a 1 was seen; this condition does not impact how the received character is treated

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: 5.1.0: Added registers to disable/enable CRC32. And also to inject CRC32 errors 5.2.0: Changed the Interrupt Pending to avoid blocking the register update when enable is 0 5.3.0: Added pending_irq register 5.4.0: Changed Logic to Wire in ift_xgmii and ift_gmii

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: 2.1.0: Added registers to disable/enable CRC32. And also to inject CRC32 errors

spirit:field.spirit:name: inject_crc32_err
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Assert high to ask the logic to insert one crc32 error when CRC32 logic is implemented.
Write a 1 and HW clears it when completed the action

spirit:field.spirit:name: disable_crc32
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set to 1, and if the CRC32 logic is implemented, disables inclusion of correct CRC32.

spirit:field.spirit:name: crc32_implmntd
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the synthesis parameter value used for CRC32 logic implementation. When 1, it shows the CRC32 logic has been implemented in the logic. Note that, typically CRC32 MUST be implemented in MAC. However, due to some timing issues, we may decide to not have the logic when the system is used in a point-to-point configuration.

spirit:field.spirit:name: dbg_seq_num_en
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When set to 1 it enables the debug logic to insert consecutive sequence numbers in the frame.
Typically, this and the corresponding register in the RX path should be configured before any traffic sent between the TX and RX. Otherwise, there will not be synchrony between the sent and expected sequence numbers for at least one time

spirit:field.spirit:name: en
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set to 1 it enables the block. NOT USED.

spirit:register.spirit:name: da_word1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Destination Address Word1

spirit:field.spirit:name: da_w1
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the MAC Destination address (upper 2 bytes [47:32])

spirit:register.spirit:name: da_word0
spirit:register.spirit:description: Destination Address Word0

spirit:field.spirit:name: da_w0
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the MAC Destination address (lower 4 bytes [31:0])

spirit:register.spirit:name: sa__word1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Source Address Word1

spirit:field.spirit:name: sa_w1
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the MAC Source address (upper 2 bytes [47:32])

spirit:register.spirit:name: sa_word0
spirit:register.spirit:description: Source Address Word0

spirit:field.spirit:name: sa_w0
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the MAC Source address (lower 4 bytes [31:0])

spirit:register.spirit:name: lt
spirit:register.spirit:description: Length/Type Filter

spirit:field.spirit:name: lt_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description: When 0: The LT field is to be the Length of the payload When 1: The LT field is to be the Type of the payload

spirit:register.spirit:name: frm_rate
spirit:register.spirit:description: The extra gap (in addition to the mandatory gap) between each Ethernet frame allowing a fine control of the data throughput on the link.

spirit:field.spirit:name: frm_rate
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the number of idle clock cycles inserted between the frames. For each implementation, it will add frm_rate*bus_size number of MAC bits.

spirit:register.spirit:name: bandwidth_gap
spirit:register.spirit:description: This is the number of idle clock cycles inserted after a specified number of data words (equal to the clock cycles that has data) are reached. For each implementation, it will add bandwidth_gap*bus_size number of MAC bits.

spirit:register.spirit:name: bandwidth_limit
spirit:register.spirit:description: This is the number of data words (equal to the clock cycles that has data) that needs to be reached before Bandwidth Gap can be inserted.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: pause_frame
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of pause frames transmitted

spirit:register.spirit:name: out_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP EOP seen on the output port to the RS

spirit:register.spirit:name: out_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP SOP seen on the output port to the RS

spirit:register.spirit:name: stall_ptp_in
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of cycles the MAC input is stalled

spirit:register.spirit:name: in_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the EOP of the PTP packets seen from the clients and after the input stall logic

spirit:register.spirit:name: in_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the EOP of the PTP packets seen from the clients and after the input stall logic

spirit:register.spirit:name: fsm_count_beyond_ptp
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the number of cycles the FSM has been beyond the permissible maximum value. This indicates an error in the function of this block

spirit:register.spirit:name: fsm_rollover
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the number of times the input FSM rolled over. This indicates an error in the function of this block

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: media_rs
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Registers needed for the Media RS in the TX Path

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_xgmii_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: When 1, and tx_xgmii_en is 0, it enables the XGMII path

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_gmii_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: When 1, and tx_xgmii_en is 0, it enables the GMII path

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: Version 1.1.0: Added Icron Attributes for stats script generation

spirit:register.spirit:name: clear
spirit:register.spirit:description: Synchronous clear for the write clock domain

spirit:field.spirit:name: drp_on_sop
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, drops the current packet without writing it to the buffer. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: drp_on_pkt_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, removes the packet from the buffer without presenting it to the output interface upon the ERR bit being set before the notification point. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: pkt_strm
spirit:field.spirit:description: Selects packet based or streaming based behavior. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: flw_ctrl_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enables the flow control. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: ntfy_lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the number of words required to be written into the packet FIFO before a notification will be generated. See wiki

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the Write Engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: nfifo_dcount
spirit:register.spirit:description: Current level for the notification FIFO in the PFIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: pfifo_dcount
spirit:register.spirit:description: Current level for the packet FIFO in the PFIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_max_byte_cnt_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count for capped packets in PFIFO write engine, as the result of reaching maximum size in the PFIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: fifo_full_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count for either of PFIFO or NFIFO being full

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of packets tagged to be dropped later in the PFIFO read engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_sop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of packets flushed in the PFIFO during the SOP phase

spirit:register.spirit:name: wflush_act
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of capped packets in the PFIFO. Note that back-to-back packets are counted as one if they are both capped.

spirit:register.spirit:name: drp_pkt_rd
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of drop packets flagged to be dropped by the read engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: drp_pkt_wr
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of drop packets by the write engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: flow_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of the clock cycles the DRDY is asserted low resulting in flow control

spirit:register.spirit:name: clear
spirit:register.spirit:description: Synchronous clear for the read clock domain

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the Read Engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rflush_act
spirit:register.spirit:description: The counts of number of packets flushed from the PFIFO.

spirit:register.spirit:name: drp_pkt
spirit:register.spirit:description: The counts of drop packet in the PFIFO read engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: flow_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of the clock cycles the DRDY is asserted low resulting in flow control

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the GMII

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: inbuff_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP EOP saved into the buffer

spirit:register.spirit:name: inbuff_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP SOP saved into the buffer

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats1

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: gmii_outbuff_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP EOP after the buffer and seen on the GMII output port

spirit:register.spirit:name: gmii_outbuff_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP SOP after the buffer and seen on the GMII output port

spirit:register.spirit:name: gmii_done

spirit:register.spirit:name: gmii_start

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats2

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: xgmii_outbuff_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP EOP after the buffer and seen on the XGMII output port

spirit:register.spirit:name: xgmii_outbuff_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP SOP after the buffer and seen on the XGMII output port
