spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the XGMII FSM starting to process a packet

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: 3.1.0: Fixed bug in Max Cycle Error where in certain mode the cycles were included in the count 3.2.0: Changed the Interrupt Pending to avoid blocking the register update when enable is 0 3.3.0: Added pending_irq register

spirit:field.spirit:name: implemented
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the synthesis parameter value used. When 1, it shows the PTP Guard fix logic has been implemented

spirit:field.spirit:name: activate
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When 1, and if the fix logic is implemented, it instructs the PTP Guard to fix the PTP violations it detects (and reports). Note that there is a synthesis parameter to generate the "fix" logic or not
When 0, no attempt is done to fix (even if the logic exists) and the PTP Guard will only work as a monitor and reports the violations detected.
For full details of the operation, what violations are detected and fixed, and how the fix is done, see the wiki.

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycle_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
This configures the mode of counting towards max_cycles:
0x0: All PTP cycles are included in the count 0x1: PTP cycles with backpressure (drdy=1'b0) are excluded from the count 0x2: PTP cycles with wait (srdy=1'b0) are excluded from the count 0x3: PTP cycles with either backpressure or wait are excluded from the count. Hence, only "absorbed" PTP cycles are included in the count
Other mode values are reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycles
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Sets the maximum number of clock cycles the PTP packet can last between its sop and eop taking into account the max_cycle_mode
When set to 0, it instructs the logic not to fix this violation (when the fix logic is available). However, the monitor will still issue a violation when the cycle count reaches its maximum and rollover.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: missing_sop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Counts the number of PTP violations due to missing sop where the srdy was asserted without a prior sop assertion

spirit:register.spirit:name: missing_eop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Counts the number of PTP violations due to missing eop where the PTP had been started but a new sop is seen without ending the previously started PTP

spirit:register.spirit:name: max_cycle_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Counts the number of PTP violations due to reaching the maximum allowed cycles after starting a new PTP

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: irq0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Define the IRQ group

spirit:register.spirit:name: enable
spirit:register.spirit:description: The enable for the actual interrupt signals. Writing a 1 enables the interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycle_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on PTP violations due to reaching the maximum allowed cycles after starting a new PTP

spirit:field.spirit:name: missing_eop_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on PTP violations due to missing eop where the PTP had been started but a new sop is seen without ending the previously started PTP

spirit:field.spirit:name: missing_sop_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on PTP violations due to missing sop where the srdy was asserted without a prior sop assertion

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending
spirit:register.spirit:description: The actual interrupt(s) that has triggered. Write a 1 to clear.

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending_irq
spirit:register.spirit:description: Registered version of pending & enable.

spirit:register.spirit:name: raw
spirit:register.spirit:description: The status registered values for the interrupt signals, if applicable.

spirit:field.spirit:name: enable
spirit:field.spirit:description: Connects CH0 to the self-test logic when it is 0x1, provided the proper parameter (p_impl_self_test) is set to "YES"

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: media_gen
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Registers needed for the Media Generator needed for self-test

spirit:register.spirit:name: mca_mgen
spirit:register.spirit:description: Media generator configuration register

spirit:field.spirit:name: iwg_cnt
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator inter-word count select. This is the number of srdy "not ready" (srdy = 1'b0) cycles that can be inserted between words.
0 = 0 cycles 1 = 1 cycle 2 = 2 cycles 3 = 0-3 cycles

spirit:field.spirit:name: ifg_cnt
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator inter-frame count select. This is the number of clock cycles that can be inserted between packets.
0 = 0 cycles 1 = 1 cycle 2 = 1023 cycles 3 = rdm 1-1023 cycles

spirit:field.spirit:name: pkt_cnt
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator packet count select.
0 = constant - set ConfigMgenX.Go='0' to stop. 1 = 1 time 2 = 1024 times 3 = 65535 times

spirit:field.spirit:name: pkt_size
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator packet size select.
0 = fix 10 bytes 1 = fix 1000 bytes 2 = inc 1-1023 bytes 3 = rdm 1-1023 bytes

spirit:field.spirit:name: throttle
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator throttle enable. Allows CPU to control media generator transmitter source ready (srdy).
0 = srdy with/without drdy (may cause loss of traffic) 1 = srdy with drdy

spirit:field.spirit:name: mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator traffic mode select.
0 = incrementing data 1 = random data

spirit:field.spirit:name: enable
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator enable. Must be set '0' if the corresponding media is trying to connect to the pipe. Can also be set '0' to stop a media generator that is set for continuous mode. Set '1' if setting go '1'.
0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:register.spirit:name: max_byte
spirit:register.spirit:description: Maximum bytes in incoming PTP bytes

spirit:register.spirit:name: mac_dg_type
spirit:register.spirit:description: MAC Datagram Type used in the out PTP

spirit:register.spirit:name: timer_wait
spirit:register.spirit:description:
Maximum number of clock cycles that is allowed to hold a new incoming PTP before it is put into a MAC Datagram if the input PTPs are not back-to-back and the downstream is not busy. The timer starts when a new PTP is received. This timer gives a control of aggregating input PTPs that are gapped.
Note: A value of 0x0 instructs the logic to not wait for input PTPs if they are gapped, unless the downstream is busy in which case the logic will always wait for gapped input PTPs unless the next PTP has the "potential" to go over the MTU size

spirit:register.spirit:name: mtu_size
spirit:register.spirit:description:
This is the MTU size to use.
Note that the FPGA build must have been built with the highest of normal MTU=1500 or Jumbo MTU=9000 (see max_mtu_size). Accordingly, this value should be less than that.

spirit:register.spirit:name: max_mtu_size
spirit:register.spirit:description: This is the MTU size used during the FPGA build.

spirit:field.spirit:name: force_xgmii_rf
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Instructs the Link Layer TX to send Remote Fault order-set on the XGMII.
This control provides a back-door to Link Fault Signaling that is normally taken care of by the FPGA, and is mutually exclusive with force_xgmii_idle.

spirit:field.spirit:name: force_xgmii_idle
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Instructs the Link Layer TX to send Idle Character on the XGMII.
This control provides a back-door to Link Fault Signaling that is normally taken care of by the FPGA, and is mutually exclusive with force_xgmii_rf.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: irq0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Define the IRQ group

spirit:register.spirit:name: enable
spirit:register.spirit:description: Indicating a rollover for that particular count has occurred

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending
spirit:register.spirit:description: Indicating a rollover for that particular count has occurred

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending_irq
spirit:register.spirit:description: Registered version of pending & enable

spirit:register.spirit:name: raw
spirit:register.spirit:description: Indicating a rollover for that particular count has occurred

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: 6.1.0: Added registers to disable/enable CRC32 check. 6.2.0: Changed the Interrupt Pending to avoid blocking the register update when enable is 0 6.3.0: Added pending_irq register

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: mac_client_interface
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Registers needed for the Clients

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: client_array
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Registers needed for the Clients Array

spirit:field.spirit:name: client_flow_ctrl_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set to 1, it enables the flow control feature of that client, whereby the client drdy is monitored in this block before presenting the next cycle of the PTP. When set to 0, it disables the flow control and the PTP traffic is presented without "listening" the drdy from the client.

spirit:field.spirit:name: client_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set to 1, it enables the flow of traffic to the client. When 0, the port is disabled and no traffic is presented to the client.

spirit:register.spirit:name: da_filter_word1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Destination Address Filter Word1

spirit:field.spirit:name: da_filter_w1
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the MAC Destination address allowed to pass (upper 2 bytes [47:32])

spirit:register.spirit:name: da_filter_word0
spirit:register.spirit:description: Destination Address Filter Word0

spirit:field.spirit:name: da_filter_w0
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the MAC Destination address allowed to pass (lower 4 bytes [31:0])

spirit:register.spirit:name: da_filter_mask_word1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Destination Address Filter Mask Word1

spirit:field.spirit:name: da_filter_mask_w1
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the Mask for the MAC Destination address allowed to pass (upper 2 bytes [47:32]). Only the location with a "1" in this mask shall be compared in the Destination Address

spirit:register.spirit:name: da_filter_mask_word0
spirit:register.spirit:description: Destination Address Filter Mask Word0

spirit:field.spirit:name: da_filter_mask_w0
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the Mask for the MAC Destination address allowed to pass (lower 4 bytes [31:0]). Only the location with a "1" in this mask shall be compared in the Destination Address

spirit:register.spirit:name: sa_filter_word1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Source Address Filter Word1

spirit:field.spirit:name: sa_filter_w1
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the MAC Source address allowed to pass (upper 2 bytes [47:32])

spirit:register.spirit:name: sa_filter_word0
spirit:register.spirit:description: Source Address Filter Word0

spirit:field.spirit:name: sa_filter_w0
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the MAC Source address allowed to pass (lower 4 bytes [31:0])

spirit:register.spirit:name: sa_filter_mask_word1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Source Address Filter Mask Word1

spirit:field.spirit:name: sa_filter_mask_w1
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the Mask for the MAC Source address allowed to pass (upper 2 bytes [47:32]). Only the location with a "1" in this mask shall be compared in the Source Address

spirit:register.spirit:name: sa_filter_mask_word0
spirit:register.spirit:description: Source Address Filter Mask Word0

spirit:field.spirit:name: sa_filter_mask_w0
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the Mask for the MAC Source address allowed to pass (lower 4 bytes [31:0]). Only the location with a "1" in this mask shall be compared in the Source Address

spirit:register.spirit:name: lt_filter
spirit:register.spirit:description: Length/Type Filter

spirit:field.spirit:name: lt_filter
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the MAC type allowed to pass

spirit:register.spirit:name: lt_filter_mask
spirit:register.spirit:description: Length/Type Filter Mask

spirit:field.spirit:name: lt_filter_mask
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the Mask for the MAC Type allowed to pass. Only the location with a "1" in this mask shall be compared in the Type field.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: out_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP EOP seen on the output port to client

spirit:register.spirit:name: out_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP SOP seen on the output to client

spirit:register.spirit:name: filter_fifo_overflow
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the times the filter FIFO was overflowed

spirit:register.spirit:name: drop_pkt_md
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of PTP packets dropped due to the MAC Datagram filter

spirit:register.spirit:name: drop_pkt_lt
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of PTP packets dropped due to the Length/Type filter

spirit:register.spirit:name: drop_pkt_sa
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of PTP packets dropped due to the Source Address filter

spirit:register.spirit:name: drop_pkt_da
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of PTP packets dropped due to the Destination Address filter

spirit:register.spirit:name: one_cycle_pkt
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of PTP packets that are one-cycle

spirit:register.spirit:name: in_fsm_rollover
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the number of times the input FSM rolled over. This indicates an error in the function of this block

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: 2.1.0: Added registers to disable/enable CRC32 check.

spirit:field.spirit:name: inject_crc32_err
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Assert high to ask the logic to insert one crc32 check error when CRC32 logic is implemented.
Write a 1 and HW clears it when completed the action

spirit:field.spirit:name: disable_crc32
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set to 1, and if the CRC32 logic is implemented, disables checking of correct CRC32.

spirit:field.spirit:name: crc32_implmntd
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the synthesis parameter value used for CRC32 logic implementation. When 1, it shows the CRC32 logic has been implemented in the logic. Note that, typically CRC32 MUST be implemented in MAC. However, due to some timing issues, we may decide to not have the logic when the system is used in a point-to-point configuration.

spirit:field.spirit:name: dbg_seq_num_en
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When set to 1 it enables the debug logic to check for consecutive sequence number.
Typically, this and the corresponding register in the TX path should be configured before any traffic sent between the TX and RX. Otherwise, there will not be synchrony between the sent and expected sequence numbers for at least one time

spirit:field.spirit:name: en
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set to 1 it enables the block. NOTE USED.

spirit:register.spirit:name: da_word1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Destination Address Word1

spirit:field.spirit:name: da_w1
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the MAC Destination address (upper 2 bytes [47:32])

spirit:register.spirit:name: da_word0
spirit:register.spirit:description: Destination Address Word0

spirit:field.spirit:name: da_w0
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the MAC Destination address (lower 4 bytes [31:0])

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: Version 1.1.0: Added Icron Attributes for stats script generation

spirit:register.spirit:name: clear
spirit:register.spirit:description: Synchronous clear for the write clock domain

spirit:field.spirit:name: drp_on_sop
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, drops the current packet without writing it to the buffer. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: drp_on_pkt_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, removes the packet from the buffer without presenting it to the output interface upon the ERR bit being set before the notification point. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: pkt_strm
spirit:field.spirit:description: Selects packet based or streaming based behavior. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: flw_ctrl_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enables the flow control. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: ntfy_lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the number of words required to be written into the packet FIFO before a notification will be generated. See wiki

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the Write Engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: nfifo_dcount
spirit:register.spirit:description: Current level for the notification FIFO in the PFIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: pfifo_dcount
spirit:register.spirit:description: Current level for the packet FIFO in the PFIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_max_byte_cnt_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count for capped packets in PFIFO write engine, as the result of reaching maximum size in the PFIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: fifo_full_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count for either of PFIFO or NFIFO being full

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of packets tagged to be dropped later in the PFIFO read engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_sop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of packets flushed in the PFIFO during the SOP phase

spirit:register.spirit:name: wflush_act
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of capped packets in the PFIFO. Note that back-to-back packets are counted as one if they are both capped.

spirit:register.spirit:name: drp_pkt_rd
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of drop packets flagged to be dropped by the read engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: drp_pkt_wr
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of drop packets by the write engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: flow_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of the clock cycles the DRDY is asserted low resulting in flow control

spirit:register.spirit:name: clear
spirit:register.spirit:description: Synchronous clear for the read clock domain

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the Read Engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rflush_act
spirit:register.spirit:description: The counts of number of packets flushed from the PFIFO.

spirit:register.spirit:name: drp_pkt
spirit:register.spirit:description: The counts of drop packet in the PFIFO read engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: flow_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of the clock cycles the DRDY is asserted low resulting in flow control

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: pause_frame
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of pause frames received

spirit:register.spirit:name: out_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP EOP seen on the output port to Client Interface

spirit:register.spirit:name: out_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP SOP seen on the output port to Client Interface

spirit:register.spirit:name: inbuf_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the EOP of the PTP packets saved into the input buffer

spirit:register.spirit:name: inbuf_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the SOP of the PTP packets saved into the input buffer

spirit:register.spirit:name: in_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the EOP of the PTP packets seen from the RS layer

spirit:register.spirit:name: in_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the EOP of the PTP packets seen from the RS layer

spirit:register.spirit:name: crc_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of packets with CRC error

spirit:register.spirit:name: out_fsm_rollover
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the number of times the output FSM rolled over. This indicates an error in the function of this block

spirit:register.spirit:name: in_fsm_rollover
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the number of times the input FSM rolled over. This indicates an error in the function of this block

spirit:register.spirit:name: dbg_seq_num_in_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the number of times the Frame sequence number was in-error during debug mode. See also the dbg_seq_num_en

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: media_rs
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Registers needed for the Media RS in the RX Path

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_xgmii_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set to 1, and rx_gmii_en is 0, it enables the XGMII path

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_gmii_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set to 1, and rx_xgmii_en is 0, it enables the GMII path

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the GMII

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: gmii_out_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP EOP seen on the output port to MAC as the result of traffic on the GMII input port

spirit:register.spirit:name: gmii_out_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP SOP seen on the output port to MAC as the result of traffic on the GMII input port

spirit:register.spirit:name: gmii_data_error
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the GMII data error per IEEE802.3 Section 35.2.2.9

spirit:register.spirit:name: gmii_missing_sfd
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the GMII data not properly starting with an SFD resulting in dropping the frame per IEEE802.3 Section 35.2.2.7

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats1
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the XGMII

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: xgmii_out_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP EOP seen on the output port to MAC as the result of traffic on the XGMII input port

spirit:register.spirit:name: xgmii_out_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP SOP seen on the output port to MAC as the result of traffic on the XGMII input port

spirit:register.spirit:name: xgmii_data_error
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the XGMII data error per IEEE802.3 Sections 46.3.2.3 & 46.3.3.1. The count is the number of "cycles" in which there is an error character and not the number of error bytes

spirit:register.spirit:name: xgmii_missing_sfd
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the XGMII data not having the SFD in lane 3 in the next cycle following the cycle where the "start character" appears in lane 0, resulting in dropping the frame per IEEE802.3 Sections 46.3.2.3 & 46.3.3.3

spirit:register.spirit:name: xgmii_wrong_lane_start
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the XGMII frame not starting with the "start character" in Lane 0 per IEEE802.3 Sections 46.3.2.3 & 46.3.3.3

spirit:register.spirit:name: xgmii_link_ok
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the XGMII entering in Link OK status per Section 46.3.4 for Link Fault Signaling

spirit:register.spirit:name: xgmii_local_fault
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the XGMII entering in Link Local Fault status per Section 46.3.4 for Link Fault Signaling

spirit:register.spirit:name: xgmii_remote_fault
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the XGMII entering in Link Remote Fault status per Section 46.3.4 for Link Fault Signaling

spirit:register.spirit:name: xgmii_link_int
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the XGMII entering in Link Interrupt status per Section 46.3.4 for Link Fault Signaling

spirit:register.spirit:name: xgmii_runt_frm_detected
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the XGMII runt frames detected. Runt frames are then extended to minimum size Ethernet frames and marked as bad

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: 3.1.0: Fixed bug in Max Cycle Error where in certain mode the cycles were included in the count 3.2.0: Changed the Interrupt Pending to avoid blocking the register update when enable is 0 3.3.0: Added pending_irq register

spirit:field.spirit:name: implemented
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the synthesis parameter value used. When 1, it shows the PTP Guard fix logic has been implemented

spirit:field.spirit:name: activate
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When 1, and if the fix logic is implemented, it instructs the PTP Guard to fix the PTP violations it detects (and reports). Note that there is a synthesis parameter to generate the "fix" logic or not
When 0, no attempt is done to fix (even if the logic exists) and the PTP Guard will only work as a monitor and reports the violations detected.
For full details of the operation, what violations are detected and fixed, and how the fix is done, see the wiki.

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycle_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
This configures the mode of counting towards max_cycles:
0x0: All PTP cycles are included in the count 0x1: PTP cycles with backpressure (drdy=1'b0) are excluded from the count 0x2: PTP cycles with wait (srdy=1'b0) are excluded from the count 0x3: PTP cycles with either backpressure or wait are excluded from the count. Hence, only "absorbed" PTP cycles are included in the count
Other mode values are reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycles
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Sets the maximum number of clock cycles the PTP packet can last between its sop and eop taking into account the max_cycle_mode
When set to 0, it instructs the logic not to fix this violation (when the fix logic is available). However, the monitor will still issue a violation when the cycle count reaches its maximum and rollover.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: missing_sop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Counts the number of PTP violations due to missing sop where the srdy was asserted without a prior sop assertion

spirit:register.spirit:name: missing_eop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Counts the number of PTP violations due to missing eop where the PTP had been started but a new sop is seen without ending the previously started PTP

spirit:register.spirit:name: max_cycle_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Counts the number of PTP violations due to reaching the maximum allowed cycles after starting a new PTP

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: irq0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Define the IRQ group

spirit:register.spirit:name: enable
spirit:register.spirit:description: The enable for the actual interrupt signals. Writing a 1 enables the interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycle_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on PTP violations due to reaching the maximum allowed cycles after starting a new PTP

spirit:field.spirit:name: missing_eop_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on PTP violations due to missing eop where the PTP had been started but a new sop is seen without ending the previously started PTP

spirit:field.spirit:name: missing_sop_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on PTP violations due to missing sop where the srdy was asserted without a prior sop assertion

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending
spirit:register.spirit:description: The actual interrupt(s) that has triggered. Write a 1 to clear.

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending_irq
spirit:register.spirit:description: Registered version of pending & enable.

spirit:register.spirit:name: raw
spirit:register.spirit:description: The status registered values for the interrupt signals, if applicable.

spirit:field.spirit:name: enable
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enables the self-test logic when it is 0x1, provided the proper parameter (p_impl_self_test) is set to "YES". All other traffic to the downstream blocks are inhibited.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: media_analyzer
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Registers needed for the Media Analyzer needed for self-test

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: lane_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Sticky bit (for each lane) showing an error in the received data of the corresponding lane

spirit:field.spirit:name: lane_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Flags an error has occurred in a lane. This is a sticky flag. The lane_err[0] refers to Lane 0 (PTP bus [63 -:8]) and lane_err[7] to Lane 7 (PTP bus [08 -:8])

spirit:register.spirit:name: error_count
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the number of errors in each clock cycle.

spirit:field.spirit:name: error_count
spirit:field.spirit:description: Count of the number of errors in each clock cycle. **Note** that there could be more than one byte in-error in each clock cycle and this count treats that as one error

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_count
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the number of PTP Packets analyzed.

spirit:field.spirit:name: count
spirit:field.spirit:description: Count of the number of PTP packets processed at the analyzer. The count is generated when the eop is seen but it does not check if the sop was present

spirit:register.spirit:name: jumbo_lt_code
spirit:register.spirit:description: Type code used for Jumbo Frames

spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Define the IRQ group

spirit:register.spirit:description: The enable for the actual interrupt signals. Writing a 1 enables the interrupt.

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: 4.1.0: Changed the Interrupt Pending to avoid blocking the register update when enable is 0 4.2.0: Added pending_irq register

spirit:register.spirit:name: max_byte
spirit:register.spirit:description: Maximum bytes in incoming PTP bytes

spirit:register.spirit:name: mac_dg_type
spirit:register.spirit:description: MAC Datagram Type used in the out PTP

spirit:register.spirit:name: timer_wait
spirit:register.spirit:description:
Maximum number of clock cycles that is allowed to hold a new incoming PTP before it is put into a MAC Datagram if the input PTPs are not back-to-back and the downstream is not busy. The timer starts when a new PTP is received. This timer gives a control of aggregating input PTPs that are gapped.
Note: A value of 0x0 instructs the logic to not wait for input PTPs if they are gapped, unless the downstream is busy in which case the logic will always wait for gapped input PTPs unless the next PTP has the "potential" to go over the MTU size

spirit:register.spirit:name: mtu_size
spirit:register.spirit:description:
This is the MTU size to use.
Note that the FPGA build must have been built with the highest of normal MTU=1500 or Jumbo MTU=9000 (see max_mtu_size). Accordingly, this value should be less than that.

spirit:register.spirit:name: max_mtu_size
spirit:register.spirit:description: This is the MTU size used during the FPGA build.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: out_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP EOP seen on the output port

spirit:register.spirit:name: out_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the PTP SOP seen on the output port

spirit:register.spirit:name: inbuff_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the EOP of the PTP packets seen at the buffer

spirit:register.spirit:name: inbuff_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the EOP of the PTP packets seen at the buffer

spirit:register.spirit:name: in_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the EOP of the PTP packets on the input port

spirit:register.spirit:name: in_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the EOP of the PTP packets on the input port

spirit:register.spirit:name: mac_dg_size_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the MAC DataGram Size Calculation Error. This does not role over when reached its maximum

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: Version 1.1.0: Added Icron Attributes for stats script generation

spirit:register.spirit:name: clear
spirit:register.spirit:description: Synchronous clear for the write clock domain

spirit:field.spirit:name: drp_on_sop
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, drops the current packet without writing it to the buffer. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: drp_on_pkt_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, removes the packet from the buffer without presenting it to the output interface upon the ERR bit being set before the notification point. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: pkt_strm
spirit:field.spirit:description: Selects packet based or streaming based behavior. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: flw_ctrl_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enables the flow control. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: ntfy_lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the number of words required to be written into the packet FIFO before a notification will be generated. See wiki

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the Write Engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: nfifo_dcount
spirit:register.spirit:description: Current level for the notification FIFO in the PFIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: pfifo_dcount
spirit:register.spirit:description: Current level for the packet FIFO in the PFIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_max_byte_cnt_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count for capped packets in PFIFO write engine, as the result of reaching maximum size in the PFIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: fifo_full_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count for either of PFIFO or NFIFO being full

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of packets tagged to be dropped later in the PFIFO read engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_sop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of packets flushed in the PFIFO during the SOP phase

spirit:register.spirit:name: wflush_act
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of capped packets in the PFIFO. Note that back-to-back packets are counted as one if they are both capped.

spirit:register.spirit:name: drp_pkt_rd
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of drop packets flagged to be dropped by the read engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: drp_pkt_wr
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of drop packets by the write engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: flow_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of the clock cycles the DRDY is asserted low resulting in flow control

spirit:register.spirit:name: clear
spirit:register.spirit:description: Synchronous clear for the read clock domain

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the Read Engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rflush_act
spirit:register.spirit:description: The counts of number of packets flushed from the PFIFO.

spirit:register.spirit:name: drp_pkt
spirit:register.spirit:description: The counts of drop packet in the PFIFO read engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: flow_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of the clock cycles the DRDY is asserted low resulting in flow control

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: 3.1.0: Fixed bug in Max Cycle Error where in certain mode the cycles were included in the count 3.2.0: Changed the Interrupt Pending to avoid blocking the register update when enable is 0 3.3.0: Added pending_irq register

spirit:field.spirit:name: implemented
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the synthesis parameter value used. When 1, it shows the PTP Guard fix logic has been implemented

spirit:field.spirit:name: activate
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When 1, and if the fix logic is implemented, it instructs the PTP Guard to fix the PTP violations it detects (and reports). Note that there is a synthesis parameter to generate the "fix" logic or not
When 0, no attempt is done to fix (even if the logic exists) and the PTP Guard will only work as a monitor and reports the violations detected.
For full details of the operation, what violations are detected and fixed, and how the fix is done, see the wiki.

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycle_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
This configures the mode of counting towards max_cycles:
0x0: All PTP cycles are included in the count 0x1: PTP cycles with backpressure (drdy=1'b0) are excluded from the count 0x2: PTP cycles with wait (srdy=1'b0) are excluded from the count 0x3: PTP cycles with either backpressure or wait are excluded from the count. Hence, only "absorbed" PTP cycles are included in the count
Other mode values are reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycles
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Sets the maximum number of clock cycles the PTP packet can last between its sop and eop taking into account the max_cycle_mode
When set to 0, it instructs the logic not to fix this violation (when the fix logic is available). However, the monitor will still issue a violation when the cycle count reaches its maximum and rollover.

spirit:register.spirit:name: max_cycle_err

spirit:field.spirit:name: dp_rx_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enables the datapath to receive packets

spirit:field.spirit:name: dp_tx_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enables the datapath to transmit packets

spirit:field.spirit:name: dp_rx_ready
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates the datapath is ready for transmission

spirit:field.spirit:name: dp_tx_ready
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates the datapath is ready for reception

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: link
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: This register group contains channel based link management controls and status information.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: control0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: This register group contains channel based link management controls and status information.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_idl_en_min
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the minimum number of idle packets that must be received before starting to count the locally transmitted ts1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_idl_min
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the minimum number of idle packets which must be transmitted before moving to the u0 state.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_idl_min
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets minimum number of idle packets which must be received before moving to the u0 state.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_ts1_en_min
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the minimum number of ts1 packets that must be received before starting to count the locally transmitted ts1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_ts1_min
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the minimum number of ts1 packets which must be transmitted before moving to the polling_idle state.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_ts1_min
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets minimum number of ts1 packets which must be received before moving to the polling_idle state.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_idl_en_max_lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the minimum number of idle packets that must be received before starting to count the locally transmitted ts2.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_idl_max_lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the minimum number of idle packets which must be transmitted before moving to the u0 state.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_idl_max_lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets minimum number of idle packets which must be received before moving to the u0 state.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_ts2_en_max_lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the minimum number of ts2 packets that must be received before starting to count the locally transmitted ts1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_ts2_max_lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the minimum number of ts2 packets which must be transmitted before moving to the rec_idle state.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_ts2_max_lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets minimum number of ts2 packets which must be received before moving to the rec_idle state.

spirit:field.spirit:name: lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: This timer determine the rate at which ts1 packets are transmitted during polling_active (default approximately 3us)

spirit:field.spirit:name: lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: This timer determine the rate at which idle packets are transmitted during polling_idle (default approximately 3us)

spirit:field.spirit:name: lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: When in polling_ilde this timer determine how long to wait before re-starting the polling_active state. (default approximately 1ms)

spirit:field.spirit:name: lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: This timer determine the rate at which ts2 packets are transmitted during rec_active. (default approximately 0.25us)

spirit:field.spirit:name: lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: This timer determine the rate at which idle packets are transmitted during rec_idle (default approximately 0.25us)

spirit:field.spirit:name: lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: When in rec_ilde this timer determine how long to wait before declaring a recovery failure and declaring the port in-active. (default approximately 1ms)

spirit:field.spirit:name: lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: When operating in U0 this timer defines the rate at which the system transmits keep alive packets (note these are only done in absence of transmitting data). (default approximately 10us)

spirit:field.spirit:name: lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: This timer sets the maximum time limit to wait for a response to be received from the remote port to a retry-able MCUP (default approximately 100us)

spirit:field.spirit:name: lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: This sets the credit timeout.not implemented yet. (default approximately 100us)

spirit:field.spirit:name: lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: This timer sets the limit on how long to wait without seeing received traffic (link ups/data etc) from the remote end. (default approximately 500us)

spirit:field.spirit:name: lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: This timer sets the rate at which the latency packet sequence is transmitted. Results are stored in the channel associated with the test. (default approximately 100us)

spirit:register.spirit:name: cfg
spirit:register.spirit:description: General configuration settings for the link management logic

spirit:field.spirit:name: active_channels
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates how many channels are used in this instance of the MCA.

spirit:field.spirit:name: stats_chid_en
spirit:field.spirit:description:
This field is represents the bit vector which selects the channel(s) which participate in the statistics collection.
Bit X 1 - Include channel in statistics collection 0 - Exclude channel from statistics collection

spirit:field.spirit:name: bw_pkt_type
spirit:field.spirit:description: Defines the packet types which bandwidth measurements are taken measured at the egress of the MCA. 0 - all packet types 1 - lgood 2 - lcrd 3 - retriable mcup 4 - non-retriable mcup

spirit:register.spirit:name: bw_sample_timer
spirit:register.spirit:description: This register defines the sample period all bandwidth monitors use to calculate the average bandwidth. The clock reference is the core clock.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cnt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Defines the periodicity of the bandwidth sample clock

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: pfifo
spirit:register.spirit:description: Packet FIFO level. This is fixed at 16 elements (16 * 8= 128 bytes)

spirit:register.spirit:name: nfifo
spirit:register.spirit:description: Notification FIFO level. This represents the number of MCUPS in the egress FIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmd_fifo_dcount
spirit:register.spirit:description: This is the common TX Command FIFO level.All channels send link commands through this FIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: data_pkt_nrtry
spirit:register.spirit:description: This represents the number of non-retriable data-packets are being sent

spirit:register.spirit:name: data_pkt_rtry
spirit:register.spirit:description: This is the number of retriable packets which have been transmitted

spirit:register.spirit:name: idle
spirit:register.spirit:description: Number if idle packets transmitted. These should be relatively low so this counter is small.

spirit:register.spirit:name: ts2
spirit:register.spirit:description: Number if ts2 packets transmitted. These should be relatively low so this counter is small.

spirit:register.spirit:name: ts1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Number if ts1 packets transmitted. These should be relatively low so this counter is small.

spirit:register.spirit:name: lbad
spirit:register.spirit:description: Number of LBAD packets transmitted.

spirit:register.spirit:name: lrtry
spirit:register.spirit:description: Number of retry requests sent to the remote end

spirit:register.spirit:name: lcrd
spirit:register.spirit:description: Number of credit packets transmitted.

spirit:register.spirit:name: lgood
spirit:register.spirit:description: Number of LGOOD packets transmitted.

spirit:register.spirit:name: plu
spirit:register.spirit:description: Number of keep alive packets transmitted

spirit:register.spirit:name: bandwidth
spirit:register.spirit:description: This register reports the high level watermark of the egress bandwidth. *NOTE: this depends on the configuration which packets types are measured

spirit:field.spirit:name: stats_chid_en
spirit:field.spirit:description:
This field is represents the bit vector which selects the channel(s) which participate in the statistics collection.
Bit X 1 - Include channel in statistics collection 0 - Exclude channel from statistics collection

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_cmd_fifo_flc
spirit:register.spirit:description:
The RX command flow control sets the hysteresis points which enable or disable flow control globally on the data-path.
The RX command FIFO contains all responses generated from the RX link management logic. This is a relatively large FIFO and is designed to hold more data than the TX channel FIFO's.
Commands in this FIFO are critical and must not be lost. When the FIFO reaches its upper limit it will prevent transmission of data payloads over the link allowing a bias to the TX command FIFO's to drain, and henceforth allowing the RX command FIFO to drain.

spirit:field.spirit:name: hi
spirit:field.spirit:description: When the FIFO reaches this limit the system will enter flow control.

spirit:field.spirit:name: lo
spirit:field.spirit:description: When the FIFO threshold reaches this threshold flow control will be disabled and normal operation can occur.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the Write Engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmd_fifo_dcount
spirit:register.spirit:description: This is the common RX Command FIFO level.All channels receive link commands through this FIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: data_pkt_nrtry
spirit:register.spirit:description: This represents the number of non-retriable data-packets received

spirit:register.spirit:name: data_pkt_rtry
spirit:register.spirit:description: This is the number of retriable packets which have been received

spirit:register.spirit:name: idle
spirit:register.spirit:description: Number of idle packets received. These should be relatively low so this counter is small.

spirit:register.spirit:name: ts2
spirit:register.spirit:description: Number of ts2 packets received. These should be relatively low so this counter is small.

spirit:register.spirit:name: ts1
spirit:register.spirit:description: Number of ts1 packets received. These should be relatively low so this counter is small.

spirit:register.spirit:name: lbad
spirit:register.spirit:description: Number of LBAD packets received.

spirit:register.spirit:name: lrtry
spirit:register.spirit:description: Number of retry requests sent to the remote end

spirit:register.spirit:name: lcrd
spirit:register.spirit:description: Number of credit packets received.

spirit:register.spirit:name: lgood
spirit:register.spirit:description: Number of LGOOD packets transmitted.

spirit:register.spirit:name: plu
spirit:register.spirit:description: Number of keep alive packets received

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_cmd_fifo_flc
spirit:register.spirit:description: Counts the number of clock cycles the RX command FIFO flow control state has been active

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: irq0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: MCA channel interrupts

spirit:register.spirit:name: enable
spirit:register.spirit:description: Interrupt Enable register - Write 1 to enable, 0 to mask an interrupt

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending
spirit:register.spirit:description: Interrupt Pending register - This indicates which enabled interrupts have triggered, Write 1 to clear

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending_irq
spirit:register.spirit:description: Interrupt Pending register - This indicates which enabled interrupts have been triggered, Write 1 to clear

spirit:register.spirit:name: raw
spirit:register.spirit:description: This register contains the active state of interrupt sources

spirit:field.spirit:name: auto_reconnect
spirit:field.spirit:description: When this bit is set it will allow the link to automatically establish a new connection after it detects the remote port has disconnected. 0-disable 1-enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Allows the TX logic to initialize and prepare for the movement of data between the local and remote port. After the port is initialized and capable of processing a corresponding ready bit will be set in the status0 register indicating so. 0 - Places the transmit data-path into a disable state. This state is used to 1 - Enables the transmit data-path for the local channel to initialize and prepare to move data.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Allows the RX logic to initialize and prepare for the movement of data from the MCA to the application. After the port is initialized and capable of processing data a corresponding ready bit will be set in the status register indicating so. 0 - Forces RX logic into a disabled state 1 - Allows the RX logic to initialize and enter a state where data can be processed.

spirit:field.spirit:name: lnk_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: This register bit enables the link to establish a virtual connection to its remote ends (i.e. enables the LTSSM). This does not rely on the RX or TX components of the channel to be enabled. Upon connection a corresponding status bit will be set indicating that the logic connection has been established. 0 - Forces the channel into the disabled state 1 = Enables the link to establish a connection to the far end.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_rdy
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates the channel RX logic is ready to process data.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_rdy
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates the channel TX logic is ready to process data.

spirit:field.spirit:name: lnk_rdy
spirit:field.spirit:description: This indicates that the LINK has entered U0 mode and the data-path is able to move data.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ch_rdy
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates that the link, RX, and TX components of the channel are in a state which will allow client data exchange.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: link
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: This register group contains channel based link management controls and status information.

spirit:register.spirit:name: ltssm
spirit:register.spirit:description: This register manages the LTSSM

spirit:field.spirit:name: pnd_lmt_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Disables the U0 packet pending timer. 0-disable 1-enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: u0rectimeout_lmt_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Disables the activity timer when in U0. 0-disable 1-enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: u0ltimeout_lmt_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Timer used to generate link up broadcasts 0-disable 1-enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: rec_act_rpt_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Disables the recovery active repeat timer. 0-disable 1-enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: pol_idl_lmt_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Disables the master polling completion timer. 0-disable 1-enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: pol_idl_rpt_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Disables the polling idle repeat timer. 0-disable 1-enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: pol_act_rpt_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Disables the polling active repeat timer. 0-disable 1-enable

spirit:register.spirit:name: test
spirit:register.spirit:description: This register manages the LTSSM

spirit:field.spirit:name: force_bad_lcrd
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit forces the link to treat the next received lcrd command as if it were received in error.

spirit:field.spirit:name: force_bad_lgood
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit forces the link to treat the next received lgood command as if it were received in error.

spirit:field.spirit:name: force_bad_data_nrtry
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit forces the link receiver to treat the next non retriable packet as if it was received in error.

spirit:field.spirit:name: force_bad_data_rtry
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit forces the link receiver to treat the next retriable packet as if it was received in error.

spirit:field.spirit:name: go2_recovery
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit forces the local LTSSM into a recovery action. This is intended for lab testing. This bit is cleared as soon as the LTSSM enters the recovery state.

spirit:field.spirit:name: dp_tx_hdr_ovrd_time
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit controls where the system time stamp is inserted at. 1 - At the final stage before the output of the MCA.TX to the link. 0- At the arbitration input

spirit:field.spirit:name: measure_latency
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enables the round trip latency transactions protocol for this channel.

spirit:register.spirit:name: ltssm
spirit:register.spirit:description: Current State for LTSSM.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rec_idl
spirit:field.spirit:description: This port indicates that the ports are resynchronized and they are ready to enter back to U0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rec_act
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates the port is in recovery and is waiting for the remote end to acknowledge the recovery action.

spirit:field.spirit:name: u0
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates that the port is now in operating state where application data can be transmitted between the two ports.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pol_idl
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit indicates that the LTSSM has found the far end port and is waiting for the far end port to acknowledge that it has discovered this port.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pol_act
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit indicates the link is in the polling state. Polling is a discovery of the existence of a remote port.

spirit:field.spirit:name: dis
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates the LTSSM is in state disable. This is the default state from reset. As soon as software sets the link enable bit this state will transition to polling active.

spirit:field.spirit:name: inact
spirit:field.spirit:description: When in the inactive state software must clear the link enable bit and only enable it once the dis bit is set. This state is entered if the far end is disabled and re-enabled (i.e. entered polling) or if the recovery action timed out instead of completing the action.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: u0_to_rec
spirit:register.spirit:description: This register keeps track of the number of times the LTSSM state enters recovery from u0. This is not an error condition as much as it is a indication of general link health.

spirit:register.spirit:name: pol_fail
spirit:register.spirit:description: This registers counts the number of times polling failed to get a idle response after detecting a remote training packet (resulting in the return to polling)

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_frm
spirit:register.spirit:description: This counts the application side packets being transmitted through the channel

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_mcup
spirit:register.spirit:description: This counts the number of MCUP's transmitted due to transmitting the application data

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_frm
spirit:register.spirit:description: This counts the application side packets being transmitted through the channel

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_mcup
spirit:register.spirit:description: This counts the number of MCUP's transmitted due to transmitting the application data

spirit:register.spirit:name: latency
spirit:register.spirit:description: This reports the high water mark for the round trip latency measurement

spirit:field.spirit:name: mcup_pld_max_cycles
spirit:field.spirit:description: This indicates the maximum size an MCUP payload will be limited to. The MCUP size is calculated as follows: (bytes_per_clock_cycle*mcup_pld_max_size)+(bytes_per_clock_cycle-mcup_header_size) eg. for 8 bytes per clock cycle, and a header size of 4 bytes, and a default value of 8: (8*8)+(8-4) = 68

spirit:field.spirit:name: force_retry
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit will force the channel to support the retry behavior on all its packets. This bit overrides the block_retry bit.

spirit:field.spirit:name: block_retry
spirit:field.spirit:description: This bit will prevent all packets transmitted on this channel from supporting the retry behavior.

spirit:field.spirit:name: bw_src
spirit:field.spirit:description: Bandwidth measurements are derived before the fragmentation (i.e. raw bandwidth) or after the fragmentation logic.

spirit:field.spirit:name: drp_on_pkt_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: If a packet error is received during the notification point this bit will cause the FIFO to drop the packet.

spirit:field.spirit:name: flw_ctrl_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Used to enable or disable flow control from the TX FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: hys_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: If this is set the hysteresis flag will be set or cleared based on the FIFO depth.

spirit:field.spirit:name: drp_on_sop
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1 - All packets will be dropped at the input of the FIFO 0 - Normal operation

spirit:register.spirit:name: rtry_buf
spirit:register.spirit:description: Retry buffer base address

spirit:field.spirit:name: base_addr
spirit:field.spirit:description: This register sets the base address for the channels retry buffer.

spirit:field.spirit:name: hi
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the upper FIFO level at which the hysteresis will be set. This value is based on FIFO words and not bytes.

spirit:field.spirit:name: lo
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the lower FIFO level at which the hysteresis will be cleared. This value is based on FIFO words and not bytes.

spirit:register.spirit:name: bandwidth_limit
spirit:register.spirit:description:
This register defines the bandwidth range which the channel can consume. If the upper range is exceeded then the channel will enter a flow control state until the bandwidth usage drops below the lo threshold. To disable bandwidth controls set the high register to 0xffff, and the lower register to 0x0000.
Example: If bandwidth sample timer has a period of 256 core clock cycles the maximum number of bytes transmitted is 256 * 8bytes = 2048bytes (64 bit architecture in the core). If the hi register is set for 1536 this means a bandwidth which is greater than 1536/2048 =75% of the maximum bandwidth (10G with a clock of 6.4ns) will force the channel into a flow control condition. If the lower threshold is 1434 then the ratio is 1434/2048 which is approximately = 0.70 or 70% of the maximum bandwidth. When the bandwidth drops below this value then the flow control condition will be disabled.
*Note the bandwidth is the ratio of the number of bytes transmitted during a sample period divided by the maximum number of bytes which could be transmitted during the same period.

spirit:field.spirit:name: hi
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the upper limit on the bandwidth operating range. This is used to limit the channels bandwidth consumption. Values of bandwidth which exceed this value will cause the transmit flow control mechanism for this channel to be asserted.

spirit:field.spirit:name: lo
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the lower limit on the bandwidth operating range. This is used to limit the channels bandwidth consumption. Values of bandwidth which drop below this value will cause the transmit flow control mechanism for this channel to be de-asserted.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the Write Engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmd_fifo
spirit:register.spirit:description: TX Command FIFO - This FIFO contains link commands (derived from link protocol responses/actions)

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_pfifo
spirit:register.spirit:description: Packet FIFO level. This represents the data for all the packets held in the FIFO subsystem.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_nfifo
spirit:register.spirit:description: Notification FIFO level. This represents the number of packets in the FIFO subsystem.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_fifo_rd_drp_pkt
spirit:register.spirit:description: Indicates the number of times a packet has been dropped at the read side of the receive FIFO.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_fifo_wr_drp_pkt
spirit:register.spirit:description: The write side of the FIFO has dropped the application packet

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_fifo_wr_pkt_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Indicates the packet was written into the FIFO which was received with the error flag set during the notify condition.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_fifo_fifo_full_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: When flow control is disabled this indicates that the FIFO had reached its full point. If this happens during a packet it will be truncated and the error flag asserted with the EOP flag.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_grd_no_sop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: This Error indicates that MCUP data after and EOP is being transmitted.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_grd_no_eop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: This error indicates that there was an EOP missing between two SOP's.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_grd_max_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: This error indicates that the MCUP exceeded the maximum MCUP packet size (i.e. 64bytes).

spirit:register.spirit:name: bandwidth
spirit:register.spirit:description: This register reports the high level watermark of the channels bandwidth.

spirit:field.spirit:name: hys_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enables a hysteresis flag to operate based on the write side FIFO count.

spirit:field.spirit:name: min_lvl_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description: When in this mode the FIFO will not indicate there is data in the FIFO until the minimum level of data or EOP is written into the FIFO. The FIFO will continue to transmit until the FIFO is emptied at which point it will not start transmitting again until the FIFO has been filled back up to the minimum level again.

spirit:field.spirit:name: drp_on_pkt_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: If a packet error is received during the notification point this bit will cause the FIFO to drop the packet at the read engine.

spirit:field.spirit:name: drp_on_sop
spirit:field.spirit:description: Prevents all application packets from being written into the FIFO.

spirit:field.spirit:name: pkt_strm
spirit:field.spirit:description: 1-packet mode. The data is not provided to the destination until the EOP is written into the FIFO 0-Streaming mode. The data is not provided to the destination until the ntfy_mode register value (in bytes) has been written into the FIFO

spirit:field.spirit:name: lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Depending on the mode of the FIFO two options can be set. Minimum level mode (number of FIFO words) Packet/Streaming mode (number of BYTES) The two modes cannot operate at the same time so this register is used for both controls.

spirit:field.spirit:name: lvl
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the lower FIFO level at which the hysteresis will be cleared. This value is based on FIFO words and not bytes.

spirit:field.spirit:name: lvl
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the upper FIFO level at which the hysteresis will be set. This value is based on FIFO words and not bytes.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the Write Engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_pfifo
spirit:register.spirit:description: Packet FIFO level. This represents the data for all the packets held in the FIFO subsystem.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_nfifo
spirit:register.spirit:description: Notification FIFO level. This represents the number of packets in the FIFO subsystem.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_fifo_rd_drp_pkt
spirit:register.spirit:description: Indicates the number of times a packet has been dropped at the read side of the receive FIFO.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_fifo_wr_drp_pkt
spirit:register.spirit:description: The write side of the FIFO has dropped the application packet

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_fifo_wr_pkt_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Indicates the packet was written into the FIFO which was received with the error flag set during the notify condition.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_fifo_fifo_full_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: When flow control is disabled this indicates that the FIFO had reached its full point. If this happens during a packet it will be truncated and the error flag asserted with the EOP flag.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_fifo_pkt_max_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Indicates that the max size packet was written into the FIFO.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_grd_no_sop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: This Error indicates that MCUP data after and EOP is being transmitted.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_grd_no_eop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: This error indicates that there was an EOP missing between two SOP's.

spirit:register.spirit:name: dp_grd_max_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: This error indicates that the MCUP exceeded the maximum MCUP packet size (i.e. 64bytes).

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: irq0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: MCA channel interrupts

spirit:register.spirit:name: enable
spirit:register.spirit:description: Interrupt Enable register - Write 1 to enable, 0 to mask an interrupt

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending
spirit:register.spirit:description: Interrupt Pending register - This indicates which enabled interrupts source been occurred. Only generates an interrupt when the corresponding enable bit is set. Write 1 to clear.

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending_irq
spirit:register.spirit:description: Interrupt Pending register - This indicates which enabled interrupts have been triggered, Write 1 to clear

spirit:register.spirit:name: raw
spirit:register.spirit:description: This register contains the active state of interrupt sources

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: tx
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Registers needed for the Media Generator needed for self-test

spirit:register.spirit:name: iwg_cnt
spirit:register.spirit:description: inter word gap count

spirit:field.spirit:name: setting
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator inter-word gap count. This is the number of srdy "not ready" (srdy = 1'b0) cycles that can be inserted between words.
0 = 0 cycles 1 = 1 cycle 2 = 2 cycles ect..

spirit:register.spirit:name: ifg_cnt
spirit:register.spirit:description: inter frame gap count

spirit:field.spirit:name: setting
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator inter-frame gap count. This is the number of clock cycles that can be inserted between packets.
0 = 0 cycles 1 = 1 cycle 2 = 2 cycles ect..

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_cnt
spirit:register.spirit:description: number of packets to send

spirit:field.spirit:name: setting
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator packet count select.
Set to "0" for continuous transmission mode.

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_size
spirit:register.spirit:description: packet length size in number of bytes

spirit:field.spirit:name: setting
spirit:field.spirit:description: Media generator packet length size in number of bytes

spirit:register.spirit:name: ctrl0
spirit:register.spirit:description: Media generator configuration register

spirit:field.spirit:name: random
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Randomization of the following register control setting (internally driven)
iwg_cnt ifg_cnt pkt_size
0 = disabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: throttle
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator throttle enable. Allows CPU to control media generator transmitter source ready (srdy).
0 = srdy with/without drdy (may cause loss of traffic) 1 = srdy with drdy

spirit:field.spirit:name: mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator "data" traffic mode select.
0 = incrementing data 1 = random data

spirit:field.spirit:name: enable
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator enable. Must be set '0' if the corresponding media is trying to connect to the pipe. Can also be set '0' to stop a media generator that is set for continuous transmission mode. Actual transmission will not start until the go bit is hit (ie: first enable then hit go bit).
0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: go
spirit:field.spirit:description: Go/Busy (Cleared by HW) write: 0 = disabled 1 = start of test read: 0 = test complete 1 = test is running

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the mgen_tx

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: wait_count
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transmit wait count of destination not ready (drdy)

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_count
spirit:register.spirit:description: Transmit packet count

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: rx
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Registers needed for the Media Generator needed for self-test

spirit:register.spirit:name: mgen
spirit:register.spirit:description: Media generator configuration register

spirit:field.spirit:name: en_rxflw
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Receiver drdy ready (flow control)
0 = drdy receiver not ready 1 = drdy receiver ready

spirit:field.spirit:name: mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator traffic mode select.
0 = incrementing data 1 = random data

spirit:field.spirit:name: enable
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Media generator enable. Must be set '0' if the corresponding media is trying to connect to the pipe. Can also be set '0' to stop a media generator that is set for continuous mode. Set '1' if setting go '1'.
0 = disabled 1 = enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: go
spirit:field.spirit:description: *Not implemented (expected possible future use)* Go/Busy (Cleared by HW)

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the mgen_rx

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: err_count
spirit:register.spirit:description: Receive error count

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_count
spirit:register.spirit:description: Receive packet count

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: Version

spirit:register.spirit:name: configuration
spirit:register.spirit:description: General configuration

spirit:field.spirit:name: vid_color_format
spirit:field.spirit:description: DP video color format 2'b00: RGB888 2'b01: YCbCr444 2'b10: YCbCr422 2'b11: YCbCr420

spirit:field.spirit:name: apb_to_axi_mode_select
spirit:field.spirit:description: APB to AXI read mode select 1'b1: The read cycle is at least one clock later than read address cycle 1'b0: The read cycle happens at the same cycle as read address cycle

spirit:field.spirit:name: enh_frm_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: DP enhanced framing mode enable. The enhanced mode is enabled when this bit is set to 1.

spirit:field.spirit:name: lane_bit_rate
spirit:field.spirit:description: DP serial bit rate 2'b00: RBR (1.62 Gbps) 2'b01: HBR (2.70 Gbps) 2'b10: HBR2 (5.40 Gbps) 2'b11: HBR3(8.10 Gbps)

spirit:field.spirit:name: lane_num
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of active dp lanes 2'b00: 1 lane 2'b01: 2 lanes 2'b10: Invalid 2'b11: 4 lanes

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: aligner
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Aligner module registers

spirit:register.spirit:name: control
spirit:register.spirit:description: Aligner module control register

spirit:register.spirit:name: status
spirit:register.spirit:description: Aligner module bond/align status register

spirit:field.spirit:name: lanes_not_aligned
spirit:field.spirit:description: Alignment is not correct even though bond_align_done is set to high

spirit:field.spirit:name: bond_align_done
spirit:field.spirit:description: Alignment and bonding status. A "1" indicates all active lanes are bonded and aligned

spirit:register.spirit:name: stats
spirit:register.spirit:description: Aligner lanes not aligned

spirit:field.spirit:name: lanes_not_aligned_cnt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of clock cycles where lanes are not aligned after detection is enabled

spirit:field.spirit:name: lanes_not_aligned_cnt_rst
spirit:field.spirit:description: Align detector logic enable 1'b0: Disable 1'b1: Enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: lanes_align_det_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Align detector logic enable 1'b0: Disable 1'b1: Enable

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: debug
