spirit:register.spirit:description: Aligner module FIFO status register

spirit:field.spirit:name: overflow
spirit:field.spirit:description:
FIFO overflow status. A "1" indicates overflow in FIFO.
Bit[12] corresponds to lane 0 FIFO Bit[13] corresponds to lane 1 FIFO Bit[14] corresponds to lane 2 FIFO Bit[15] corresponds to lane 3 FIFO

spirit:field.spirit:name: underflow
spirit:field.spirit:description:
FIFO underflow status. A "1" indicates underflow in FIFO.
Bit[8] corresponds to lane 0 FIFO Bit[9] corresponds to lane 1 FIFO Bit[10] corresponds to lane 2 FIFO Bit[11] corresponds to lane 3 FIFO

spirit:field.spirit:name: full
spirit:field.spirit:description:
FIFO full status. A "1" indicates FIFO is full
Bit[4] corresponds to lane 0 FIFO Bit[5] corresponds to lane 1 FIFO Bit[6] corresponds to lane 2 FIFO Bit[7] corresponds to lane 3 FIFO

spirit:field.spirit:name: empty
spirit:field.spirit:description:
FIFO empty status. A "1" indicates FIFO is empty
Bit[0] corresponds to lane 0 FIFO Bit[1] corresponds to lane 1 FIFO Bit[2] corresponds to lane 2 FIFO Bit[3] corresponds to lane 3 FIFO

spirit:register.spirit:name: raw
spirit:register.spirit:description: This register contains the registered state of interrupt signals

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_e_width
spirit:field.spirit:description: Image width, in pixels. Must be a multiple of 2. Up to 2048 for HD core flavor, 4096 for 4K core flavor, 8192 for 8K core flavor, and 10240 for 10K core flavor.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_e_height
spirit:field.spirit:description: Image height, in pixels. Must be a multiple of 2, and greater than or equal to 2 in profile 1, 8 in profile 2.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_e_comp
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of color components. Fixed to 3.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_e_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Configures the color format and sub-sampling
- 4'b0000: RGB - 4'b0001 YCbCr422 - 4'b1000 YCbCr444

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_e_hlvls
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of horizontal decompositions in the horizontal wavelet transform. Fixed to 5.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_e_vld
spirit:field.spirit:description: It validates the given configuration. Set to '1' to start the core, after setting mode and images parameters. Note: to start the core, the user_rst signal must also be inactive.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_e_nbr
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of images to play when the core is in command mode.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_e_bgt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Budget in bytes for a single picture. The budget is allocated to the picture header and the compressed data. Note: To compute this value according to a bit per pixel rate: budget = bpp x width x height / 8

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_e_vid_depth
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Bit depth of the video content, mapped on the MSBs of the port interface. The valid bit depths are 8, 10 and 12 bits per component
4'b1000: 8 bits 4'b1010: 10 bits 4'b1100: 12 bits

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_e_play_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description: It allows to choose between two running modes: - set to '1' to run in play mode, in which the core processes frames continuously. - set to '0' to run in command mode, in which the core processes n frames, n defined by TICO_E_NBR.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_e_lvl_weights
spirit:field.spirit:description: This register is used to program the image quality optimization (visual or PSNR), see Rate allocation configuration and optimization (page 24) section for more details.

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: Version

spirit:register.spirit:name: aux_status
spirit:register.spirit:description: Error bits for source/sink and misc status bits

spirit:field.spirit:name: aux_sense_p_in_debounce
spirit:field.spirit:description: Aux + line status after de-bouncing 1: DP source device is not connected 0: DP source device is connected

spirit:field.spirit:name: aux_sense_n_in_debounce
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Aux - line status after de-bouncing
1: DP source device provides power on DP_PWR pin 0: DP source device does not provide power for sink

spirit:field.spirit:name: aux_sense_p_in
spirit:field.spirit:description: Aux + line status 1: DP source device is not connected 0: DP source device is connected

spirit:field.spirit:name: aux_sense_n_in
spirit:field.spirit:description: Aux - line status 1: DP source device provides power on DP_PWR pin 0: DP source device does not provide power for sink

spirit:field.spirit:name: tps_sel

spirit:field.spirit:name: lane_num

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_d_config
spirit:field.spirit:description: This register sets general core configuration parameters. bit 0: AUTO-RESET Set to '1' to force a user_rst and core_rst after the last output data, on each frame. This feature is transparent and automatic, and does not change the control nor its configuration. It resets the core between frames to prevent rare cases in which the core remains in a bad state after processing a frame whose codestream was corrupted. See also the WaitLastCS bit below for further details. Set to '0' (default) to disable this feature. bit 1: WaitLastCS Set to '1' to wait for both the last codestream input data and the last video output data before auto-resetting the core, in auto-reset mode or when an error occurred. This mode can be selected when the input codestream is reliable or is at least guaranteed to contain a 'last data' flag. This mode must be selected when vid_ fixed_latency_flag is not monitored and the last codestream word could arrive after the last video output word. Set to '0' (default) to wait for the last output video data only, before auto-resetting the core. This mode must be chosen when the input codestream may have missing or corrupted data, especially if the last codestream word may be missing. CONFIDENTIAL and

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_d_width
spirit:field.spirit:description: Image width, in pixels. Must be a multiple of 2. Up to 2048 for HD core flavor, 4096 for 4K core flavor, 8192 for 8K core flavor, and 10240 for 10K core flavor.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_d_height
spirit:field.spirit:description: Image height, in pixels. Must be a multiple of 2, and greater than or equal to 2 in profile 1, 8 in profile 2.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_d_comp
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of color components. Fixed to 3.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_d_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description: bit 1-0: (R) sub-sampling mode (extracted from picture header) 00b = 4:4:4 01b = 4:2:2 10b = 4:2:0 bit 2: (R/W) downscale set to '1' to downscale output resolution by a factor 2. set to '0' for standard resolution. (default)

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_d_hlvls
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of horizontal decompositions in the horizontal wavelet transform. Fixed to 5.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_d_vld
spirit:field.spirit:description: Contains several mode configuration fields: bit 1-0: (R) sub-sampling mode (extracted from picture header), 00b = 4:4:4, 01b = 4:2:2, 10b = 4:2:0 bit 2: (R/W) downscale set to '1' to downscale output resolution by a factor 2. set to '0' for standard resolution. (default)

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_d_nbr
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of images to play when the core is in command mode.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_d_bgt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Budget in bytes for a single picture. The budget is allocated to the picture header and the compressed data. Note: To compute this value according to a bit per pixel rate: budget = bpp x width x height / 8

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_d_vid_depth
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Bit depth of the video content, mapped on the MSBs of the port interface. The valid bit depths are 8, 10 and 12 bits per component
4'b1000: 8 bits 4'b1010: 10 bits 4'b1100: 12 bits

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_d_play_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description: It allows to choose between two running modes: - set to '1' to run in play mode, in which the core processes frames continuously. - set to '0' to run in command mode, in which the core processes n frames, n defined by TICO_D_NBR.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_d_profile
spirit:field.spirit:description: Codestream profile: 1: Profile 1 2: Profile 2 The profile must be compliant with the core performance and configuration.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_d_line_duration
spirit:field.spirit:description: Number of clock cycles per video line (horizontal blanking included). This register is used to generate the fixed latency flag signal.

spirit:field.spirit:name: tico_d_line_duration
spirit:field.spirit:description: Image size configuration of the Video Out Synchronizer. When this register is null, the Video Out Synchronizer takes the image size from the codestream header. Otherwise, it takes it from this register and disregards the codestream header, which is safer in an environment where codestream corruption is possible. bits 31-16: image width bits 15-1: image height / 2 (number of line pairs) bit 0: subsampling mode, 0 = 4:4:4, 1 = 4:2:2 / 4:2:0 Note: this register is only used for the Video Out Synchronizer, not for the TICO decoder which must take the image size from the picture header.

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: 2.0.0: Added new clock for ITP Manager Support. 3.0.0: Added new reset domain for UPP and separated from XUSB3 3.1.0: Changed the Interrupt Pending to avoid blocking the register update when enable is 0 3.2.0: Added pending_irq register 3.3.0: Bug fix and register name change 3.4.0: Bug fix in RX Partner Manager 3.5.0: Add sensitivity to DPH and DPP in RX Partner, and number of other enhancements 3.5.1: Removed back pressure to MCA that resulted timing loop, and removed mark_debug to improve timing 3.5.2: put back the back pressure to MCA again but enabled write pipeline for PFIFO to address timing loop 4.0.0: Add elastic buffer registers and bug fix for purging data

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_buff_near_full_limit
spirit:field.spirit:description: The number of cycles limit of the RX Partner FIFO before its maximum value over which the DPP portion of the in data is dropped and only DPH are saved to guard against any lost DPH.

spirit:field.spirit:name: upp_bypass
spirit:field.spirit:description: This register is only valid when upp_is_present=1. When set to 0, it enables the USB Protocol Partner (UPP) logic in the XUSB3 and moves the traffic through the UPP. When set to 1, it bypasses the UPP and the traffic is from USB Link Partner (ULP) to/from core.

spirit:field.spirit:name: upp_is_present
spirit:field.spirit:description: This register shows if the UPP logic has been instantiated in the logic.

spirit:field.spirit:name: split_dp_wait_time
spirit:field.spirit:description: Indicates the number of Core Cycles that the RX Partner Manager waits for the DPP portion of a split DP packet to arrive. After this wait, if the DPP does not arrive, the logic will send the DPH portion to the Host and will drop the DPP if it comes later. A value of 0 disables this wait and requires back-2-back DPH and DPP. Note the impact of this value on the USB end-to-end latency on one extreme and on the integrity of the USB DP packet delivery on the other.

spirit:field.spirit:name: split_dp_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description: When 1, it instructs to split the DP USB packets into DPH and DPP packets when sent over the system link as two independent PTP packets. These DPH and DPP PTP packets will join on the other side into the same DP USB in normal operation (not in retry operation)

spirit:field.spirit:name: allow_rx_buff_fill
spirit:field.spirit:description: When 1, it allows the RX Link Partner buffer to accept the partner's packet even if the Link Layer (ULP) is not ready to process these packets yet. The ULP is only ready to process these packets when it is in U0 and has finished the LMP.

spirit:field.spirit:name: drop_itp_pkts
spirit:field.spirit:description: When 1 it instructs the LEX to drop the ITP packets and not send them to REX.

spirit:field.spirit:name: upstream_port
spirit:field.spirit:description: When 1, it indicates the XUSB3 works as an Upstream Port (used in LEX). When 0, it is a Downstream port used in REX.

spirit:field.spirit:name: remove_crdts
spirit:field.spirit:description: When 1, it forces the Link Layer to not issue credit to its USB link partner. This will effectively stop receiving any data or header packets from the link partner. This bit is mainly for debugging and software should not use it under normal system usage.

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: Version 1.1.0: Added Icron Attributes for stats script generation

spirit:register.spirit:name: clear

spirit:field.spirit:name: drp_on_sop
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, drops the current packet without writing it to the buffer. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: drp_on_pkt_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set, removes the packet from the buffer without presenting it to the output interface upon the ERR bit being set before the notification point. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: pkt_strm
spirit:field.spirit:description: Selects packet based or streaming based behavior. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: flw_ctrl_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Enables the flow control. See Wiki

spirit:field.spirit:name: ntfy_lmt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Sets the number of words required to be written into the packet FIFO before a notification will be generated. See wiki

spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: fifo_full_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count for either of PFIFO or NFIFO being full

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of packets tagged to be dropped later in the PFIFO read engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: pkt_sop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of packets flushed in the PFIFO during the SOP phase

spirit:register.spirit:name: wflush_act
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of capped packets in the PFIFO. Note that back-to-back packets are counted as one if they are both capped.

spirit:register.spirit:name: drp_pkt_rd
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of drop packets flagged to be dropped by the read engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: drp_pkt_wr
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of drop packets by the write engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: flow_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of the clock cycles the DRDY is asserted low resulting in flow control

spirit:register.spirit:name: clear
spirit:register.spirit:description: Synchronous clear for the read clock domain

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config

spirit:register.spirit:name: unknown_pkt_drp
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of unknown packets dropped at the TX Link Partner Manager

spirit:register.spirit:name: dwn_stream_busy_drp
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the DPP portion of DP packet being truncated when the TX Link Partner Manager downstream (MCA) is flow controlling

spirit:register.spirit:name: drop_lone_dpp
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the lone (not preceded with DPH) DPP received at the RX Link Partner Manager that were dropped

spirit:register.spirit:name: rcvd_lone_dph
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the lone DPH (not followed by DPP) received at the RX Link Partner Manager

spirit:register.spirit:name: timedout_2join_dpp
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the number of times that a DPH was received and it was not followed by a DPP after exhausting the wait period as instructed in the Configuration Register

spirit:register.spirit:name: not_rdy_pkt_drp
spirit:register.spirit:description:
Count of the number of times a PTP packet was received from the Link Partner at the RX and it was dropped as the ULP core is not ready to process yet. The ULP core is only ready to process these packets when it is in U0 and has finished the LMP.
This count only will show when allow_rx_buff_fill register in the Configuration is set to 1'b0. Otherwise, PTP packets are not dropped and are written into the buffer.

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: 3.1.0: Fixed bug in Max Cycle Error where in certain mode the cycles were included in the count 3.2.0: Changed the Interrupt Pending to avoid blocking the register update when enable is 0 3.3.0: Added pending_irq register

spirit:field.spirit:name: implemented
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the synthesis parameter value used. When 1, it shows the PTP Guard fix logic has been implemented

spirit:field.spirit:name: activate
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When 1, and if the fix logic is implemented, it instructs the PTP Guard to fix the PTP violations it detects (and reports). Note that there is a synthesis parameter to generate the "fix" logic or not
When 0, no attempt is done to fix (even if the logic exists) and the PTP Guard will only work as a monitor and reports the violations detected.
For full details of the operation, what violations are detected and fixed, and how the fix is done, see the wiki.

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycle_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
This configures the mode of counting towards max_cycles:
0x0: All PTP cycles are included in the count 0x1: PTP cycles with backpressure (drdy=1'b0) are excluded from the count 0x2: PTP cycles with wait (srdy=1'b0) are excluded from the count 0x3: PTP cycles with either backpressure or wait are excluded from the count. Hence, only "absorbed" PTP cycles are included in the count
Other mode values are reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycles
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Sets the maximum number of clock cycles the PTP packet can last between its sop and eop taking into account the max_cycle_mode
When set to 0, it instructs the logic not to fix this violation (when the fix logic is available). However, the monitor will still issue a violation when the cycle count reaches its maximum and rollover.

spirit:register.spirit:name: max_cycle_err

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: Version: 2.0.0: Adding the Control Transfer Manager and CT-Processor to the Design 3.0.0: Adding the ITP Manager, Endpoint Table, CTIM Time Tag and Skip Function, etc 3.1.0: Adding Max Burst to the Endpoint Table 3.2.0: Changed the Interrupt Pending to avoid blocking the register update when enable is 0 3.3.0: Added pending_irq register and Add Ping and Bulk IN Termination 4.0.0: Adding BInterval and Independent ISO REX Scheduling for Service Interval Binning. Also, add LEX PFIFOs and ITP Registers 4.1.0: Cleanup register map and added ISO Null Queue 4.1.1: Removed mark_debug and also added read pipline for the PFIFO to improve timing 4.2.0: Add interrupts for ISO Device Non-Response. 4.3.0: Add interrupts for PING not responding 4.3.1: Remove Latches 4.4.0: Use CPU Plug IPs rather than stand alone logic for h2d and d2h

spirit:field.spirit:name: ping_non_rspns_cnt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Every Service Interval when a PING is sent to the device and a PING RESPONSE is not received, a count is incremented. When the counter reaches this value, it will issue an interrupt to software

spirit:field.spirit:name: dp_max_numb_cnt
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the total number of full-size DP packets that needs to be allocated in one ITP. This value together with dp_max_time_cnt divide an ITP period into multiple section of available "credits". The "credits" are used to schedule ISO packets such that they don't fall on ITP boundary.

spirit:field.spirit:name: dp_max_time_cnt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Maximum "cycle" time for one DP packet. This is typically 2.117 us and for our 4-byte implementation and clock period of 8 ns (125MHz frequency) it is about 264. This counter value with the help of dp_max_numb_cnt divide an ITP period into multiple sections of available "credits". The "credits" are used to schedule ISO packets such that they don't fall on ITP boundary.

spirit:field.spirit:name: limit_num_pings_snt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Set to 1 to limit the number of PING Request sent to one PING in every 2ms (when device is not responding to PING). To avoid flooding the REX Hub that can cause credit_hp_timer firing, the default is enabled such that it only sends a PING requests every ~2ms when device is not responding (when device is disconnected).

spirit:field.spirit:name: iso_dev_non_rspns_cnt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Every Service Interval when the device is asked for data and it does not respond at least with one DP, a count is incremented. When the counter reaches this value, it will issue an interrupt to software.

spirit:field.spirit:name: lex_buff_max_cnt
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is maximum full DP size of the LEX buffers in each ISO (accelerated) queue. This is used on the REX to follow the buffer occupancy on the LEX. Typical value should be less than 45

spirit:field.spirit:name: disable_itp_delta
spirit:field.spirit:description: Set to 1 to disable modifying the ITP Delta field in the Isochronous Timestamp (ITS) of Table 8-26 Section 8.7.

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_itp_deviation_2fix
spirit:field.spirit:description: Maximum deviation of incoming ITP from Bus Boundary for the ITP Manager to fix immediately. This number should be (deviation us/8 ns). Default value of 128 represents about 1us deviation

spirit:field.spirit:name: limit_max_burst
spirit:field.spirit:description: Set to 0 to let the REX ISO Scheduler to base its burst size on the device Max Burst. By default, the burst size follows the host value.

spirit:field.spirit:name: bulk_term_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Set to 0 to disable BULK IN Termination Method (BITM)

spirit:field.spirit:name: ping_term_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Set to 1 to enable the Ping Termination Method (PTM) that terminates the PING protocol in UPP

spirit:field.spirit:name: ctrl_trfr_int_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description: When 0, the ctrl_trfr (h2d and d2h) interrupts are packet based (rising sop). When 1, the interrupt is cycle based (each srdy causes interrupt)

spirit:field.spirit:name: init_ept
spirit:field.spirit:description: Assert high to clear and initialize the EndPoint Table (EPT).

spirit:field.spirit:name: itp_gen
spirit:field.spirit:description: Assert high to instruct the ITP Manager on the REX, when it is enabled, to independently start sending ITP packets to the device as soon as its Link Layer is in U0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: itp_manager_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Assert high to have the ITP Manager on the REX enabled such that it can track the ITPs from the Host and independently issue an ITP when the 125us timer elapses and no ITP is received.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ctrl_manager_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Assert high to enable the Control Transfer Manager. When not enabled, the UPP does not interfere with or terminate Control Transfers. As the result, Host and Device will interact directly.

spirit:field.spirit:name: clr_ctrl_trfr_mgr
spirit:field.spirit:description: Assert high to clear all the state tables in the Control Transfer Manager

spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of capped packets in the PFIFO. Note that back-to-back packets are counted as one if they are both capped.

spirit:register.spirit:name: drp_pkt_rd
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of drop packets flagged to be dropped by the read engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: drp_pkt_wr
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of drop packets by the write engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: flow_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of the clock cycles the DRDY is asserted low resulting in flow control

spirit:register.spirit:name: clear
spirit:register.spirit:description: Synchronous clear for the read clock domain

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the Read Engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: rflush_act
spirit:register.spirit:description: The counts of number of packets flushed from the PFIFO.

spirit:register.spirit:name: drp_pkt
spirit:register.spirit:description: The counts of drop packet in the PFIFO read engine

spirit:register.spirit:name: flow_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: The count of the clock cycles the DRDY is asserted low resulting in flow control

spirit:register.spirit:description: Version 1.1.0: Added Icron Attributes for stats script generation

spirit:register.spirit:name: clear

spirit:register.spirit:name: h2d_data

spirit:field.spirit:name: h2d_data
spirit:field.spirit:description: Data of the packet for Host to Device. Data is filled from the most significant (31:24) byte

spirit:register.spirit:name: h2d_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: Control Transfer packet sideband signals for Host to Device

spirit:field.spirit:name: time_tag
spirit:field.spirit:description: Event time tag recorded in each cycle.

spirit:field.spirit:name: vlane
spirit:field.spirit:description: Valid number of "lanes" where each lane is one bye

spirit:register.spirit:name: h2d_skip
spirit:register.spirit:description: This register allows the software to skip certain number of cycles in the h2d data and control registers.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cycles
spirit:field.spirit:description: Write once into this register with the number of cycles that the h2d_data and h2d_ctrl need to be skipped. A zero value will skip to the eop of the packet.

spirit:field.spirit:name: squelch_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Set to 1 to zero out the data sent to the SW when injecting CRC32 error in the Control Transfer. Note that the data is squelched from the third cycle (from bytes 9) onwards, including the CRC32. Also note that the data is NOT squelched to the Device and only CRC32 is errored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: crc32_term_value
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Every time a Control data packet is seen, a counter is incremented. When this terminus value is reached, the counter resets back to 0.
Note value of 0 is NOT valid.

spirit:field.spirit:name: crc32_err_inj_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Set to 1 to enable the CRC32 error injection logic and counter in the Control Transfers. When enabled, the counter is enabled and the logic will inject CRC32 errors when the crc32_term_value is reached in the counter.

spirit:register.spirit:name: d2h_data
spirit:register.spirit:description: Control Transfer packet Data portion for the Device to Host

spirit:field.spirit:name: d2h_data
spirit:field.spirit:description: Data of the packet for Device to Host. Data is filled from the most significant (31:24) byte

spirit:register.spirit:name: d2h_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: Control Transfer packet sideband signals for Device to Host

spirit:field.spirit:name: time_tag
spirit:field.spirit:description: Event time tag recorded in each cycle.

spirit:field.spirit:name: vlane
spirit:field.spirit:description: Valid number of "lanes" where each lane is one bye

spirit:register.spirit:name: d2h_skip
spirit:register.spirit:description: This register allows the software to skip certain number of cycles in the d2h data and control registers.

spirit:field.spirit:name: cycles
spirit:field.spirit:description: Write once into this register with the number of cycles that the d2h_data and d2h_ctrl need to be skipped. A zero value will skip to the eop of the packet.

spirit:field.spirit:name: squelch_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Set to 1 to zero out the data sent to the SW when injecting CRC32 error in the Control Transfer. Note that the data is squelched from the third cycle (from bytes 9) onwards, including the CRC32. Also note that the data is NOT squelched to the Host and only CRC32 is errored.

spirit:field.spirit:name: crc32_term_value
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Every time a Control data packet is seen, a counter is incremented. When this terminus value is reached, the counter resets back to 0.
Note value of 0 is NOT valid.

spirit:field.spirit:name: crc32_err_inj_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Set to 1 to enable the CRC32 error injection logic and counter in the Control Transfers. When enabled, the counter is enabled and the logic will inject CRC32 errors when the crc32_term_value is reached in the counter.

spirit:register.spirit:name: cmpltd
spirit:register.spirit:description: When Software completes processing a Control Transfer, it writes into this register to signal the completion of the processing for the Transfer

spirit:field.spirit:name: device_addr
spirit:field.spirit:description: Device Address that the Software completed processing its Control Transfer

spirit:register.spirit:name: config0
spirit:register.spirit:description:
This register is used to configure the EndPoint Table (EPT) in the logic for IN Endpoints. It is the lowest 32 bit word. See config1 for the upper 32 bit word.
Software shall write into this register to initiate and configure the EPT, when it has already written into the upper "word" (config1)
NOTE**: A write into any field shall result in an update of the EPT. Therefore, the register should be updated once for a set of data and individual fields should not be written into unless other fields are kept as before.
NOTE**: When writing into this "word", the data in the second "word" (config1) MUST be valid.

spirit:field.spirit:name: null_en
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Set to 1 to null out the EndPoint.
Currently, this only applies to the ISO EndPoints (bm_attributes_tt=1).
When this bit is set, it blocks the ACK to reach the Device and terminates the ACK on the LEX by sending Null Data Packets to the Host.
When this bit is set, the qid MUST be 0.

spirit:field.spirit:name: bm_attributes_tt
spirit:field.spirit:description:
This field is configured based on the Transfer Type bits of bmAttritues of Table 9-24 in Section 9.6.6.
Set to 0 to remove the EndPoint Set to 1 for ISO IN endpoints Set to 2 for Bulk IN endpoints set to 3 for Interrupts IN endpoints

spirit:field.spirit:name: qid
spirit:field.spirit:description:
The Queue ID (QID) is the buffer number that the duality of is assigned to.
The total number of QIDs available is reported in qid_total_num. Also, the up to date assignment of QIDs are reported in qid_assigned.
Note that QID=0 is always assigned to "non-ISO" traffic needed in the logic and cannot be assigned by the software for any ISO traffic. However, when null_en is set, the qid MUST be 0 for the ISO EndPoints.

spirit:field.spirit:name: device_addr
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the USB Device Address in the EPT

spirit:field.spirit:name: ept_num
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the USB Endpoint Number in the EPT

spirit:register.spirit:name: config1
spirit:register.spirit:description:
This register is used to configure the EndPoint Table (EPT) in the logic for IN Endpoints. It is the highest 32 bit word. See config0 for the lower 32 bit word.
NOTE**: The data in this "word" MUST be written before attempting to write into the lower "word" (config0).

spirit:field.spirit:name: crdt_chk_value
spirit:field.spirit:description: An indication of a "guard" before ITP boundary. It is a value of Total "Credit" (each one being a full DP) left before end of ITP. Typically, this should be zero. Any larger value could limit the bandwidth used.

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_burst
spirit:field.spirit:description: This field should be set such that it is not more than the Value of bMaxBurst of Section 9.6.7 and at the same time it does not impact the system performance with a large value. Typical values of 2 or 3 (if the device bMaxBurst is more than these values) could be a god compromise in most setups. If bMaxBurst is smaller than typical values above, this field should be the exact number equal to bMaxBurst.

spirit:field.spirit:name: coded_binterval
spirit:field.spirit:description: Hot coding to show the number of BInterval of Section 9.6.6. As example, BInterval=1 --->coded_binterval=2^0; BInterval=7 ---> coded_binterval=2^6; BInterval=16 ---> coded_binterval=2^15

spirit:field.spirit:name: total_qid
spirit:field.spirit:description: Total number of QID that has been implemented in the logic.

spirit:field.spirit:name: qid_assigned0
spirit:field.spirit:description: One-hot encoded register that shows which QID is currently assigned. A one (1) in each bit position indicates that QID is already assigned.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: missing_itp
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count the number ITP packets that did not receive at the REX

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: irq0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Define the IRQ group

spirit:register.spirit:name: enable
spirit:register.spirit:description: The enable for the actual interrupt signals. Writing a 1 enables the interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: d2h_pkt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on availability of a packet in the Data to Host path in Control Transfer

spirit:field.spirit:name: h2d_pkt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on availability of a packet in the Host to Data path in Control Transfer

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending
spirit:register.spirit:description: The actual interrupt(s) that has triggered. Write a 1 to clear.

spirit:field.spirit:name: d2h_pkt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on availability of a packet in the Data to Host path in Control Transfer

spirit:field.spirit:name: h2d_pkt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on availability of a packet in the Host to Data path in Control Transfer

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending_irq
spirit:register.spirit:description: Registered version of pending & enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: d2h_pkt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on availability of a packet in the Data to Host path in Control Transfer

spirit:field.spirit:name: h2d_pkt
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on availability of a packet in the Host to Data path in Control Transfer

spirit:register.spirit:name: raw
spirit:register.spirit:description: The status registered values for the interrupt signals, if applicable.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: irq1
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Define the IRQ group

spirit:register.spirit:name: enable
spirit:register.spirit:description: The enable for the actual interrupt signals. Writing a 1 enables the interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ping_not_respond
spirit:field.spirit:description: Each bit fires on an ISO device not responding to PING REQUESTs for a defined number of times. The bit position refers to the EndPoint Queue.

spirit:field.spirit:name: iso_not_respond
spirit:field.spirit:description: Each bit fires on an ISO device not responding for a defined number of times. The bit position refers to the EndPoint Queue.

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending
spirit:register.spirit:description: The actual interrupt(s) that has triggered. Write a 1 to clear.

spirit:field.spirit:name: ping_not_respond
spirit:field.spirit:description: Each bit fires on an ISO device not responding to PING REQUESTs for a defined number of times. The bit position refers to the EndPoint Queue.

spirit:field.spirit:name: iso_not_respond
spirit:field.spirit:description: Each bit fires on an ISO device not responding for a defined number of times. The bit position refers to the EndPoint Queue.

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending_irq
spirit:register.spirit:description: Registered version of pending & enable

spirit:field.spirit:name: ping_not_respond
spirit:field.spirit:description: Each bit fires on an ISO device not responding to PING REQUESTs for a defined number of times. The bit position refers to the EndPoint Queue.

spirit:field.spirit:name: iso_not_respond
spirit:field.spirit:description: Each bit fires on an ISO device not responding for a defined number of times. The bit position refers to the EndPoint Queue.

spirit:register.spirit:name: raw
spirit:register.spirit:description: The status registered values for the interrupt signals, if applicable.

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: 8.0.1: Cleanup and add synchronizer to phy_reset_n to avoid direct path to the output pad 8.1.0: Changed the Interrupt Pending to avoid blocking the register update when enable is 0 8.2.0: Added pending_irq register 8.3.0: Fixed Hot Reset bug; Added in_u0 to the 'rdy' to the top level; Bring in_hot_reset and in_warm_reset to upper layer 8.3.1: Cap Remote RX Credit Count to 4 8.4.0: Changed from Logic to Wire for ift_ulp_pipe 8.5.0: Add Timer Corrections 8.5.1: Bug fixes 8.5.2: Bug fixes (5466, 4724, 4808) 8.5.3: Address timing issues for previous fix 8.5.4: Infinite Loop and signal reset assignment missing fixed 9.0.0: Many Enhancement and bug fixes for LFPS, Polarity Detection, RX Detect, data exception handing, U3 wakeup, register operations, etc

spirit:field.spirit:name: internal_loopback_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: When 1 it enables an RX Loopback (Section 6.8.4) implementation in the USB Link Layer rather than the PHY

spirit:field.spirit:name: quasi_ss_disabled_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description: When 1, it puts the USB PHY into P2 power mode rather than the normal P3 as required by the Standard

spirit:field.spirit:name: quasi_u3_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When 1, it handshakes U3 protocol with the USB partner but puts the USB PHY into P2 low power mode.
This mode could be used for debugging, or in case of any bug in normal U3 mode as USB PHY PCLK is removed in U3

spirit:field.spirit:name: allow_u2
spirit:field.spirit:description: Assert high to allow U2 Low Power request to be processed. When low, it will always issue LXU. Section 7.2.4.2.3 Item 3

spirit:field.spirit:name: allow_u1
spirit:field.spirit:description: Assert high to allow U1 Low Power request to be processed. When low, it will always issue LXU. Section 7.2.4.2.3 Item 3

spirit:field.spirit:name: dfp_compliance_mode_en
spirit:field.spirit:description: Section 7.5.4.3.1 Item 4: A downstream port shall enable its transition path to Compliance Mode, if directed

spirit:field.spirit:name: use_trx_detect_quiet_dfp_max
spirit:field.spirit:description: Section 7.5.3.7.1 and Table 7-12 (Note 1): Implementations are recommended to consider system states when choosing when to use a larger value of the tRxDetectQuietTimeoutDFP timer. Using a smaller value when the system is active and a larger value when the system is in a standby/sleep or other idle state allows for higher responsiveness to connect events during active states while enabling power savings in an idle system state.

spirit:field.spirit:name: wait_in_polling_lfps
spirit:field.spirit:description: When 1, it instructs the port to wait in Polling.LFPS. Note this wait is NOT based on standard but only for LEX/REX extension benefit. Also note the 360 ms timer of this state

spirit:field.spirit:name: exit_low_power
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Assert high to initiate exit from U1, U2, or U3 Low Power. Section 7.2.4.2.7 and Sections 7.5.8.2 Item 7, 7.5.8.2 Item 6, and 7.5.9.2 Item 5
Write a 1 and HW clears

spirit:field.spirit:name: wait_in_u3
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When set, allows the software to hold the port in its exit handshaking (either initiated by link partner or self initiated) to come out U3 following Section 7.2.4.2.7.
Note the limit time based on Table 6-30 in Section 6.9.2. A 20ms for U3 (t13-t10)

spirit:field.spirit:name: wait_in_u1_u2
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When set, allow the software to hold the port in its exit handshaking (either initiated by link partner or self initiated) to come out U1, U2 following Section 7.2.4.2.7.
Note the limit time based on Table 6-30 in Section 6.9.2. A 2ms for U1/U2 (t13-t10)

spirit:field.spirit:name: delay_u3_wakeup
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Assert high to delay the start of the wakeup. This applies to both when the port is Master (initiating) of U3 wakeup or Slave (responding) to U3 wakeup.
In effect, it will delay t10 of Figure 6-30 when it is Master or t11 when it is Slave.
NOTE:
If this bit is set when the port is a master of wakeup and remains asserted, it will result in squelching the wakeup LFPS. If it remains asserted for over 10ms, an interrupt is issued informing software of a wakeup failure, as the Slave will never see wakeup to be able to respond. Both ports will remain in U3. In this configuration, this bit can be used as a test bit as well.
If this bit is et when the port is a slave of wakeup and remains asserted, the master port will see a tNOLFPSReponseTimeout and both ports remain in U3. In this configuration, this bit can be used as a test bit.

spirit:field.spirit:name: go_u3
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Assert high to initiate a U3 Low Power when in U0. Section 7.2.4.2.3 and Section 7.5.6.2 Item 3 NOTE: This can only be done when it is a downstream port. Otherwise, no action is taken
Write a 1 and HW clears it

spirit:field.spirit:name: go_u2
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Assert high to initiate a U2 Low Power when in U0. Section 7.2.4.2.3 and Section 7.5.6.2 Item 2
Write a 1 and HW clears it

spirit:field.spirit:name: go_u1
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Assert high to initiate a U1 Low Power when in U0. Section 7.2.4.2.3 and Section 7.5.6.2 Item 1
Write a 1 and HW clears it

spirit:field.spirit:name: wait_in_hot_reset
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When set, allows the software to kepp the port in hot reset whenever it enters and, thus, prevents the handshake of HotReset.Active in Section 7.5.12.3.2 to complete.
Note the 12 ms timer for tHotResetActiveTimeout as the LTSSM will slip into eSS.Inactive from the Hot Reset state on expiry of this timer

spirit:field.spirit:name: gen_warm_reset
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Section 6.9.3: A downstream port may issue a Warm Reset at any Link states except SS.Disabled. See also 10.3.1.6, the Resetting State of a Downstream Port
Write a 1 and HW clears it

spirit:field.spirit:name: allow_rx_term_en_hw_clr
spirit:field.spirit:description: When set to 1, it allows the Hardware to self clear rx_termination_en when entering back into rx_termination reset. When set to 0, the hardware does not clear rx_termination_en bit at any time.

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_termination_en
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Enable presenting ULP RX termination. Set to 1 when the port is to present its RX Termination to the USB partner. Writing a 0, will remove the termination to the USB partner and enables a "stealth mode".
HW clears this bit (when allow_rx_term_en_hw_clr is asserted) when the LTSSM goes into the RX.Detect.Reset

spirit:field.spirit:name: go2_ss_inactive
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Section 7.5.6.2 Item 10, A downstream port shall transition to eSS.Inactive when directed
Write a 1 and HW clears it

spirit:field.spirit:name: go2_recovery
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Section 7.5.6.2 Item 7: The port shall transition to Recovery when directed
Write a 1 and HW clears it

spirit:field.spirit:name: go2_hot_reset
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Section 7.5.10.5.2 Item 5: A downstream port shall transition to Hot Reset when directed
Write a 1 and HW clears it when completed the action

spirit:field.spirit:name: go2_loopback
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Section 7.5.4.10.2 Item 1, 7.5.10.5.2 Item 1: The port shall transition to Loopback when directed as a loopback master and the port is capable of being a loopback master
Write a 1 and HW clears it when completed the action
NOTE: Not Implemented, as we are always a loopback slave

spirit:field.spirit:name: disable_scrambling
spirit:field.spirit:description: Section 7.5.4.10.1 Item 5: ( This is for the TX Scrambler) The port in SuperSpeed operation shall disable the scrambling if directed

spirit:field.spirit:name: set_ts2_disable_scramble_bit
spirit:field.spirit:description: Section 7.5.4.9.1 Item 1.3: When directed, the port shall set the Disabling Scrambling bit in the TS2 ordered set. This shall eventually be used in the RX De-Scrambler

spirit:field.spirit:name: go2_rx_detect
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Section 7.5.1.1.2 Item 1: A downstream port shall transition to Rx.Detect when directed
Write a 1 and HW clears it.

spirit:field.spirit:name: add_2_cht
spirit:field.spirit:description: Each value adds (2^13)*8 ns (8 is the result of the block running at 125MHz) to the CREDIT_HP_TIMER of Table 7-7. Hence, value of 2 adds 2*8192*8=131.072us

spirit:field.spirit:name: add_2_pht
spirit:field.spirit:description: Each value adds (2^5)*8 ns (8 is the result of the block running at 125MHz) to the PENDING_HP_TIMER of Table 7-7. Hence, value of 2 adds 2*32*8=512ns

spirit:register.spirit:name: ltssm_state
spirit:register.spirit:description: Shows the LTSSM State at the time

spirit:field.spirit:name: main_state
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the main state of the LTSSM as listed in the Standard Section 7.5

spirit:field.spirit:name: sub_state
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the sub state of the LTSSM as listed in the Standard Section 7.5

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration for the ULP Core Clock

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_lfps_cnt_in_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the number of TX LFPS counter going beyond the largest value possible

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_lfps_cnt_in_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the number of RX LFPS counter going beyond the largest value possible

spirit:register.spirit:name: tx_framer_ptp_violated
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count the number of PTP Protocol Violation in the TX Frame Manager

spirit:register.spirit:name: link_training_ptp_violated
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count the number of PTP Protocol Violation in the Link Training Manager

spirit:register.spirit:name: link_command_ptp_violated
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count the number of PTP Protocol Violation in the Link Command Manager

spirit:register.spirit:name: lmp_ptp_violated
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count the number of PTP Protocol Violation in the LMP Manager

spirit:register.spirit:name: link_command_rx_event_fifo_overflow
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count the number of Link Command RX Event FIFO Overflow

spirit:register.spirit:name: link_command_rx_event_fifo_underflow
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count the number of Link Command RX Event FIFO Underflow

spirit:register.spirit:name: lmp_rx_event_fifo_overflow
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count the number of LMP Manager RX Event FIFO Overflow

spirit:register.spirit:name: lmp_rx_event_fifo_underflow
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count the number of LMP Manager RX Event FIFO Underflow

spirit:register.spirit:name: remote_rx_hdr_buff_crdt_cnt_in_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count the number of Remote RX Header Buffer Credit Count erroneous increment or decrement

spirit:register.spirit:name: to_phy_out_sop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count the number of PTP sop to the PHY path

spirit:register.spirit:name: to_phy_out_eop
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count the number of PTP eop to the PHY path

spirit:register.spirit:name: go2_u0_from_recovery
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the number of times LTSSM move from Recovery to U0

spirit:register.spirit:name: rx_go_recovery
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the number of recovery initiated due to received data from PHY (Section 7.6.6.2 Item 5)

spirit:register.spirit:name: snt_lrty
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the number of times the ULP has sent LRTY to its partner in response to receiving LBAD from its partner

spirit:register.spirit:name: snt_lbad
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the number of times the ULP has sent LBAD to its partner

spirit:register.spirit:name: rcvd_lrty
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the number of times the ULP has received LRTY from its partner in response to an earlier ULP sending LBAD

spirit:register.spirit:name: rcvd_lbad
spirit:register.spirit:description: Count of the number of times the ULP has received LBAD from its partner

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: 3.1.0: Fixed bug in Max Cycle Error where in certain mode the cycles were included in the count 3.2.0: Changed the Interrupt Pending to avoid blocking the register update when enable is 0 3.3.0: Added pending_irq register

spirit:field.spirit:name: implemented
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the synthesis parameter value used. When 1, it shows the PTP Guard fix logic has been implemented

spirit:field.spirit:name: activate
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When 1, and if the fix logic is implemented, it instructs the PTP Guard to fix the PTP violations it detects (and reports). Note that there is a synthesis parameter to generate the "fix" logic or not
When 0, no attempt is done to fix (even if the logic exists) and the PTP Guard will only work as a monitor and reports the violations detected.
For full details of the operation, what violations are detected and fixed, and how the fix is done, see the wiki.

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycle_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
This configures the mode of counting towards max_cycles:
0x0: All PTP cycles are included in the count 0x1: PTP cycles with backpressure (drdy=1'b0) are excluded from the count 0x2: PTP cycles with wait (srdy=1'b0) are excluded from the count 0x3: PTP cycles with either backpressure or wait are excluded from the count. Hence, only "absorbed" PTP cycles are included in the count
Other mode values are reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycles
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Sets the maximum number of clock cycles the PTP packet can last between its sop and eop taking into account the max_cycle_mode
When set to 0, it instructs the logic not to fix this violation (when the fix logic is available). However, the monitor will still issue a violation when the cycle count reaches its maximum and rollover.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: missing_sop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Counts the number of PTP violations due to missing sop where the srdy was asserted without a prior sop assertion

spirit:register.spirit:name: missing_eop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Counts the number of PTP violations due to missing eop where the PTP had been started but a new sop is seen without ending the previously started PTP

spirit:register.spirit:name: max_cycle_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Counts the number of PTP violations due to reaching the maximum allowed cycles after starting a new PTP

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: irq0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Define the IRQ group

spirit:register.spirit:name: enable
spirit:register.spirit:description: The enable for the actual interrupt signals. Writing a 1 enables the interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycle_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on PTP violations due to reaching the maximum allowed cycles after starting a new PTP

spirit:field.spirit:name: missing_eop_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on PTP violations due to missing eop where the PTP had been started but a new sop is seen without ending the previously started PTP

spirit:field.spirit:name: missing_sop_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on PTP violations due to missing sop where the srdy was asserted without a prior sop assertion

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending
spirit:register.spirit:description: The actual interrupt(s) that has triggered. Write a 1 to clear.

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending_irq
spirit:register.spirit:description: Registered version of pending & enable.

spirit:register.spirit:name: raw
spirit:register.spirit:description: The status registered values for the interrupt signals, if applicable.

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: 3.1.0: Fixed bug in Max Cycle Error where in certain mode the cycles were included in the count 3.2.0: Changed the Interrupt Pending to avoid blocking the register update when enable is 0 3.3.0: Added pending_irq register

spirit:field.spirit:name: implemented
spirit:field.spirit:description: This is the synthesis parameter value used. When 1, it shows the PTP Guard fix logic has been implemented

spirit:field.spirit:name: activate
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When 1, and if the fix logic is implemented, it instructs the PTP Guard to fix the PTP violations it detects (and reports). Note that there is a synthesis parameter to generate the "fix" logic or not
When 0, no attempt is done to fix (even if the logic exists) and the PTP Guard will only work as a monitor and reports the violations detected.
For full details of the operation, what violations are detected and fixed, and how the fix is done, see the wiki.

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycle_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description:
This configures the mode of counting towards max_cycles:
0x0: All PTP cycles are included in the count 0x1: PTP cycles with backpressure (drdy=1'b0) are excluded from the count 0x2: PTP cycles with wait (srdy=1'b0) are excluded from the count 0x3: PTP cycles with either backpressure or wait are excluded from the count. Hence, only "absorbed" PTP cycles are included in the count
Other mode values are reserved

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycles
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Sets the maximum number of clock cycles the PTP packet can last between its sop and eop taking into account the max_cycle_mode
When set to 0, it instructs the logic not to fix this violation (when the fix logic is available). However, the monitor will still issue a violation when the cycle count reaches its maximum and rollover.

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: stats0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: All the Statistic Registers and their configuration

spirit:register.spirit:name: rd2clr_config
spirit:register.spirit:description: Configures if the stats register read by s/w clears the read register. A 1 in any bit configures the h/w to clear the corresponding stats register after a s/w read of that stats register.

spirit:register.spirit:name: missing_sop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Counts the number of PTP violations due to missing sop where the srdy was asserted without a prior sop assertion

spirit:register.spirit:name: missing_eop_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Counts the number of PTP violations due to missing eop where the PTP had been started but a new sop is seen without ending the previously started PTP

spirit:register.spirit:name: max_cycle_err
spirit:register.spirit:description: Counts the number of PTP violations due to reaching the maximum allowed cycles after starting a new PTP

spirit:registerFile.spirit:name: irq0
spirit:registerFile.spirit:description: Define the IRQ group

spirit:register.spirit:name: enable
spirit:register.spirit:description: The enable for the actual interrupt signals. Writing a 1 enables the interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: max_cycle_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on PTP violations due to reaching the maximum allowed cycles after starting a new PTP

spirit:field.spirit:name: missing_eop_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on PTP violations due to missing eop where the PTP had been started but a new sop is seen without ending the previously started PTP

spirit:field.spirit:name: missing_sop_err
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on PTP violations due to missing sop where the srdy was asserted without a prior sop assertion

spirit:register.spirit:name: pending
spirit:register.spirit:description: The actual interrupt(s) that has triggered. Write a 1 to clear.

spirit:register.spirit:description: The enable for the actual interrupt signals. Writing a 1 enables the interrupt.

spirit:field.spirit:name: core_clk_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires when the core clock mode changes from system 125 to the derivative of the PCLK (1/2PCLK) or vice-versa

spirit:field.spirit:name: u3_exit_completed
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires when the U1/U2 or U3 wakeup is successfully complete

spirit:field.spirit:name: u3_as_slave_exit_failed
spirit:field.spirit:description: When Salve of exit, it fires on when U3 wakeup does not complete. This is typically is the case when the port is configured to not start its wakeup LFPS (delay t11 of Figure 6-30) before 10 ms limit.

spirit:field.spirit:name: u3_as_master_exit_failed
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When Master of exit, it fires on when the U1/U2 exit or U3 wakeup does not complete correctly due to tNOLFPSReponseTimeout.
--See Section 7.2.4.2.7 Item 5 and Item 6

spirit:field.spirit:name: u3_exit_initiated
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on when a U1/U2 exit or U3 wakeup is received

spirit:field.spirit:name: u3_entry_failed
spirit:field.spirit:description:
Fires on when our U3 does not complete and we end up in LTSSM Inactive. (NOT CONNECTED)
--see Section 7.2.4.2.4 Item 11

spirit:field.spirit:name: u3_entry_received
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on when a U3 Request is received from the USB partner Note that only a downstream partner will issue U3

spirit:field.spirit:name: u2_entry_rejected
spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on when our U2 request is rejected by the USB partner

spirit:field.spirit:description: Fires on when a U1 Request is received from the USB partner

spirit:register.spirit:name: version
spirit:register.spirit:description: 3.1.0: Changed the Interrupt Pending to avoid blocking the register update when enable is 0 3.2.0: Added pending_irq register

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_swing
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Voltage Swing Level (0=Full, 1=Low) -See PIPE Spec V3.0 Table 5-3

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_margin
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX Voltage Level (0=Normal Operating Range) -See PIPE Spec V3.0 Table 5-3

spirit:field.spirit:name: tx_deemph
spirit:field.spirit:description: TX De-emphasis (0=-6dB, 1=-3.5dB, 2=No De-Emphasis, 3=Reserved -See PIPE Spec V3.0 Table 5-3

spirit:field.spirit:name: reset_n
spirit:field.spirit:description: Resets the TX and RX (***NOTE USED NOW. PLACE HOLDER FOR LATER) -See PIPE Spec V3.0 Table 5-3

spirit:field.spirit:name: rx_eq_training
spirit:field.spirit:description: Instructs the RX to bypass normal operation to perform equalization training -See PIPE Spec V3.0 Table 5-3

spirit:field.spirit:name: elas_buf_mode
spirit:field.spirit:description: Elasticity Buffer Mode (Nominal Half Full when 0 and Nominal Empty when 1) -See PIPE Spec V3.0 Table 5-3

spirit:register.spirit:name: compliancy_ctrl
spirit:register.spirit:description: Provides manual access to do the compliancy testing if needed and the right hardware is not available

spirit:field.spirit:name: gen_lfps_ping
spirit:field.spirit:description:
When set, it signals an LFPS ping has been received in the compliancy logic forcing the next compliancy pattern
Write a 1 and HW clears it when completed the action
